column3: Recipes

1. Soften the butter from the fridge 2. Mix the butter with chopped rosemary and pepper 3. Place the steak in a large container with the butter mixture 4. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours 5. Grill with high heat 6. Add some of the garlic and rosemary from the marinade as you grill 7. Allow the steak to rest for 5 minutes before serving

1. Heat olive oil in skillet over high heat 2. Add salt and pepper to steak 3. Place steaks in hot skillet and immediately turn down heat to medium high 4. Cook steaks for 4 minutes on each side or to your taste 5. Remove steaks to a platter and cover with foil to keep warm 6. Remove skillet from heat and add butter and garlic 7. Return to heat and add mushrooms and saute until done 8. Add flour and cook for about a minute 9. Decrease heat to medium low 10. Then add wine and broth 11. Bring to a boil 12. Stir constantly until thick 13. Remove pan from heat and add rosemary

1. Combine the first four ingredients in a ziploc bag or shallow pan 2. Add steaks to marinade 3. Marinate for 1-2 hours  4. Turn steaks in marinade frequently 5. Grill steaks to desire doneness 6. Grill for 3-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare / medium doneness 7. While steaks are grilling 8. Combine vinegar and blue cheese to a creamy consistency 9. Serve sauce as a condiment to steaks

1. First, in a blender, combine soy sauce, mustard, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, thyme, pepper, and rosemary 2. Blend until smooth 3. Brush both sides of steaks with mixture 4. Grill or broil 4 minutes on each side for medium-rare 5. Grill or broil longer for desired taste 6. Each time turn the steaks 7. Brush with sauce 8. Discard sauce after grilling / broiling

1. Saute oysters , mushrooms , and parsley in the butter until the mushrooms are tender 2. Drain off butter 3. Stir in the bacon, cheese, and wine 4. Set them aside 5. Make a pocket in the side of the steak 6. Stuff pocket with the oyster mixture 7. Secure with wooded picks 8. Broil steaks about 6 inches from heat for about 8-10 minutes on each side or until desired doneness 9. Top steaks with any leftover oyster stuffing

1. Preheat oven to 190c 2. Mix all the ingredients together in a small saucepan and simmer for 5 minutes 3. Reserve 1 / 4 of the glaze 4. Sit the duck on a rack over a baking dish, baste and place in oven 5. Baste the duck every 10 minutes throughout the cooking process with remaining 3 / 4 of glaze 6. A 2kg duck should take about 1 hour 15 minutes to cook, but give one of its legs a pull, and if it moves freely and any juices run clear, your duck will be cooked 7. Place on a serving platter, brush with reserved glaze and serve 8. Pass any remaining reserved glaze to be spooned over carved duck.

1. Marinate duck in remaining ingredients for about 8 hours 2. Turn occasionally through the day 3. Heat oven to 160c / 330f 4. Remove the duck from the marinade and lay on a foil lined baking sheet 5. Bake for 2 hours or until very tender 6. You may need to pour off the fat a couple of times during the cooking time 7. Serve the duck on rice with oriental noodle salad

1. Combine stock and water into saucepan and heat till liquid is simmering 2. Add, galangal, chillies, and lime juice to saucepan 3. Bruise lemon grass and coriander, and add to saucepan 4. Simmer liquid for 20 minutes 5. Strain liquid, and return to saucepan 6. Heat liquid with duck and shallots 7. Boil ramen noodles in separate saucepan for 3-5 minutes or till tender 8. Drain noodles 9. Add noodles and bak choy to soup stock and simmer for 5 minutes 10. Ladle soup to serving bowls, garnishing with bean sprouts, chilli strips, and coriander 11. Add salt and pepper to taste 12. Best enjoyed hot

1. Preheat the barbeque 2. Using a sharp knife, cut a long slit in the fleshy side of each duck breast to make a pocket 3. Divide the apricots and shallots between the pockets and secure with skewers 4. Mix the honey, soy sauce, and sesame oil together in a small bowl and brush all over the duck 5. Sprinkle with the chinese five-spice powder 6. To make the garnish, make a few cuts lengthways down the stem of each scallion 7. Place in iced water and leave until the stems start to curl 8. Drain before using 9. Cook the duck over medium hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side 10. Remove the skewers, set on a bed of cous cous and garnish with the scallion curls 11. Serve immediately

1. Place ribs in bottom of large slow cooker 2. In a large bowl, stir together teriyaki sauce, and cornstarch 3. Blend in duck sauce, and garlic 4. Pour sauce over ribs, making sure each layer is covered 5. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours, or on high for 4-5 hours

1. Peel and devein shrimp 2. Drain and flake crabmeat, removing any bits of shell 3. Set seafood aside 4. Saute onion, garlic, and celery in hot oil in a pan over med-high heat for 8 minutes, until tender 5. Stir in flour 6. Cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute 7. Stir in broth and the next 4 ingredients 8. Bring to a boil 9. Cover, decrease heat, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 30 minutes, or until potatoes are tender 10. Stir in shrimp, crabmeat, and heavy cream 11. Cook over low heat 5 minutes or just until the shrimp turn pink 12. Garnish with parsley 13. Serve

1. In large 4 quart pan brown bacon, onion, and celery until onion and celery are transparent 2. Add clam juice from clams and add diced potatoes to bacon mixture 3. Pour enough water to cover potatoes and boil until potatoes are tender 4. In a separate large sauce pan, melt 2 cubes of butter on low heat 5. When butter is melted, slowly add 3 / 4 cup of flour, stirring constantly 6. Add 1 quart half and half stir with wire whisk until thick and smooth 7. Pour over undrained vegetable mixture, add vinegar and heat thoroughly 8. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder to taste

1. Drain juice from clams over veggies in small pan 2. Add enough water to cover and simmer until tender 3. Meantime, melt butter, add flour & blend, stirring constantly 4. Add cream slowly & stir with wire whisk until smooth and thick 5. Add undrained veggies, clams & vinegar & heat throughly 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste

1. Transfer all ingredients into a gallon storage / freezer bag 2. Refrigerate the mixture overnight , 3. Drain excess liquid, add salt, then serve over tostadas 4. Cod & halibut work well and can be substituted for shrimp 5. I enjoy a blend with squid, baby octopus, & shrimp

1. Place lime juice in saucer or small bowl 2. Make sure top of glass will fit inside 3. Place celery salt in saucer 4. Dip glass in lime juice just to wet rim 5. Dip rim into celery salt 6. Fill glass with ice 7. Add vodka, clamato, tabasco & worcestershire sauce 8. Stir gently so as to not mar rim trim 9. Trim glass with a slice of lemon and a slice of lime 10. Pop in a hot pickled bean or hot pickled asparagus spear

1. Defrost the lobster tails 2. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees 3. Using kitchen shears cut down the center of top of each tail down to the base 4. Next grab each side of the shell and gently pry the shell away from the meat- leaving the meat at the base of the tail attached 5. Squeeze the shell together to close the gap and lay the meat on top of the shell 6. Gently slice the meat 3 times down the top- enough to be able to lay the meat over the sides of the shell 7. Repeat for the remaining tails 8. Place the tails in an oven safe pan and brush the top of each tail with the marinade 9. You will want to baste the tails again 2 or 3 times during the cooking process 10. Bake the tails for about 25 minutes 11. Cooking times may vary so make sure you keep an eye on the tails !

1. In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt butter, and saute garlic and shallots for 2 minutes 2. Add wine, chicken broth, black pepper, and red pepper flakes and bring to a boil over medium-high heat until the liquid starts to reduce 3. Add shrimp and cook about 5 minutes until opaque 4. Add lobster and heat thoroughly 5. Reduce heat to simmer, add cream and turn off heat after 1-2 minutes 6. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions 7. Drain 8. Remove seafood from sauce and set aside 9. Toss pasta with sauce 10. Place seafood on top of pasta, sprinkle with parsley and serve

1. In a large dutch oven, melt the butter and then saute the onions and celery over medium heat, allow to soften, about a few minutes 2. Add the potato and add only enough chicken broth to barely cover 3. Cook until the potato is just barely tender 4. Add the basil, oregano  celery salt, pepper, salt, paprika, and tabasco sauce 5. Layer the fish and shellfish on top 6. Add just enough chicken broth to cover 7. Cook only until fish barely flakes 8. Add the cream, and then fill the pot with the milk 9. If there is no room in the pot , skimp on the milk , not the cream 10. Allow the chowder to warm throughly 11. Keep on a bare simmer until serving or refrigerate and slowly heat up before serving 12. Movita boucoup recommends using at least two, 1 / 2 pound of each seafood selection in addition to the white fish 13. She strongly recommends scallops and lobster 14. Dont use any fish with a dominant flavour such as salmon, sardines, clams, etc 15. Water is traditionally used in chowders such as this and will taste just fine if you opt for that instead of broth 16. If using broth, it is recommended using a sodium reduced variety 17. If you're using canned and don't have enough, you can make up the difference with water 18. The chicken broth adds just a bit of richness to the chowder 19. Chowder is best on the second day, so when entertaining, make it the day before 20. To rewarm , put the pot on low and allow 45 minutes it to heat through 21. Do not allow the chowder to boil 22. Low heat is key 23. You will notice that the spices seem to sit on top of the chowder 24. When you serve, give a little stir and then scoop 25. Just the right amount of spice will come up with the ladle

1. Brush honey over pancetta slices , heat a skillet over fairly high heat , add a tiny drop of oil and cook pancetta just a few seconds on each side until it gets crispy , drain on paper towels 2. Combine lobster , mango , cucumbers , mayo , salt and pepper to taste 3. In another bowl , mix together lettuce , sun dried tomatoes , and basil 4. Grab some long toothpicks and 2 plates -- you will be stacking 2 sandwiches 5. Spread a little extra mayo on 2 of the toast slices , then top each with the lobster mixture , another piece of toast on top of that , then the lettuce mixture , the pancetta , then the remaining toast pieces 6. Stick 2 long toothpicks into each sandwiches to hold them together , then use a serrated knife to cut each sandwich into halves 7. Remove toothpicks before eating

1. Parboil lobster for 7 minues in salted water 2. Remove and cool 3. Place the lobster on its back and use a good sized firm knife 4. Start at the lobsters mouth and quickly slice down the middle of the body and tail 5. Use both hands to open the body and remove the stomach and the tomalley 6. Prepare a stuffing of your choice 7. Fill the body and tail of your lobster with the stuffing mix 8. Preheat oven to 450 degrees f 9. Place the stuffed lobsters on a cookie sheet, and bake for 12-15 minutes or until stuffing is browned

1. Cool sweet potatoes in an ice bath 2. Having cooked bacon in medium skillet, remove and set aside 3. Add sweet potatoes and caramelize on each side 4. Remove from heat 5. Add red onion, mustard, salt, and pepper and toss 6. Chop bacon to 1 / 4 inch strips and mix into hash 7. Fold in parsley, pecans and avocado 8. Season to taste 9. Serve warm to room temperature

1. Prepare grill 2. For each taco, spread 1 / 4 of the cheeses and 4 pcs of the asparagus on each tortilla, then season with salt and pepper 3. Fold in half and lightly brush the outside with olive oil 4. Grill for 3 minutes on each side or until the tortilla is crispy and cheese has melted 5. Add any optional ingredients

1. In a medium glass or ceramic bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of lime juice and 1 / 2 teaspoon of salt 2. Add tomatoes, avocados, scallions, and garlic 3. Using a rubber spatula, gently fold to combine 4. Season to taste with pepper 5. In large bowl, whisk together olive oil, cumin, remaining tablespoon of lime juice and 1 / 8 teaspoon of salt 6. Add lettuce and toss 7. Season to taste with pepper 8. Divide lettuce among plates 9. Top each with mound of avocado mixture 10. Top with cucumber slices 11. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve

1. In a mini chopper, chop the onion, garlic, chili flakes, and lime juice until very fine 2. Mix the chopped ingredients with the fork mashed avocado 3. Meanwhile lightly paint the baguette slices with olive oil on both sides and broil one side then the other until light golden 4. Spread the avocado mixture on the toasted baguette slices 5. Top with the chopped tomatoes and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese 6. Preheat oven to 350f heat for 10 minutes finish under the broiler for 2 more minutes or until the parmesan is golden

1. Cut the avocado in half and discard the seed 2. Mash the avocado with the other condiment ingredients in a small bowl , then refrigerate 3. In a medium bowl blend the ground beef with the salsa, fajita seasoning, and tabasco chipotle sauce 4. Divide the burger meat into six portions and make patties 5. Grill the burgers on a charcoal or gas grill 6. Toast the buns on the grill and serve the burgers topped with the cheese and avocado salsa

1. Brown ground beef in skillet, drain off fat and put in crock pot 2. Cut bacon in small pieces 3. Fry bacon and onions till brown 4. Drain off fat 5. Add bacon, onions, and remaining ingredients to crock pot 6. Stir together well 7. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 9 hours 8. If using the 2 quart crock pot, reduce this recipe by half

1. Grease 2 1 / 2 qt casserole , layer 1 / 2 potatoes , 1 / 2 onions and 1 / 2 bacon 2. Sprinkle with 1 tbl flour and 1 / 2 salt and pepper 3. Then sprinkle 1 / 2 of each cheese on top 4. Repeat layers, ending with cheese on top 5. Sprinkle chives on top and pour on 1 cup of milk 6. Cover casserole dish and bake at 375 degrees for 1 to 1 / 2 hours, or until potatoes are tender

1. Chop onions and celery, if using a food processor dont chop these too fine 2. In a large saucepan, saute onion and celery in 4 ounces of butter until tender 3. Add potatoes and broth, bring to a boil 4. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes till potatoes are tender 5. In a small skillet, melt remaining 4 ounces of butter, add flour to make roux, cook roux over low heat until yellow blond in color and set aside 6. To cooked potato and broth mixture, add water, cream and roux stirring continuously until mixture thickens 7. Stir in the cheese, bacon bits, parsley, pepper, and paprika 8. Cook over low heat until the cheese is melted, stir continuously and remove from heat when cheese is melted 9. Garnish with croutons, if desired

1. Mix the water and lemon juice in a large bowl 2. Trim the stem and outer layers of the artichokes, leaving only the yellow center of the artichokes 3. Trim the green 4. Cut the artichokes in half and soak in the water mixture 5. Heat olive oil in large frying pan on med-high heat 6. At the same time bring water to boil to cook the spaghetti 7. Saute the onions, garlic, and bacon until the bacon is crispy 8. Add the artichokes and lower heat to medium 9. Continue to cook for about 10 minutes or until artichokes are tender 10. Meanwhile cook pasta until al dente, drain and set aside 11. Whisk the eggs and cheese together 12. Once artichokes are tender add the pasta to the frying pan and stir 13. Stir in the egg mixture, continue to stir until the eggs are cooked 14. Season with salt and pepper and serve

1. Preheat oven to 350 2. In a blender combine tomatoes, garlic, onion, italian seasoning, salt, and pepper 3. Blend until pureed 4. Set pizza sauce aside 5. In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, sour cream and 2 ounces of shredded cheese 6. Mix well until well combined 7. Spread cream cheese mixture in an even layer over baking dish 8. Pour blended pizza sauce over cream cheese mixture and evenly distribute with spatula 9. Sprinkle remaining shredded cheese over pizza sauce 10. Top pizza dip with bacon and pepperoni 11. Bake for 20-25 minutes , until cheese is browned and bubbly

1. In a big pot or dutch oven, brown meat in salad dressing 2. Add the next 9 ingredients and bring to a boil 3. Reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours or till meat is tender 4. Add the potatoes , carrots , pepper and onion 5. Cover and simmer another hour or until veggies are tender 6. Combine flour and cold water in a shaker , stir into stew and bring to a boil till thickened 7. Serve

1. Brown meat and onion 2. Stir in seasonings , soup , tomatoes and rice 3. You may need a little bit of extra water if using brown instant rice 4. Bring to a boil , and then reduce the heat 5. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes , stirring occasionally , until rice is cooked 6. Serve with sliced olives 7. Salt and pepper to taste

1. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat 2. Add the ground beef and cook for 8 to 10 minutes , breaking it into 3 / 4 inch or so crumbles and stirring occasionally 3. Drain off the fat 4. Stir in the beans , broth , tomatoes and chili powder , and bring to a boil 5. Reduce heat , cover and simmer 20 minutes to develop flavors , stirring occasionally 6. Serve with toppings , as desired

1. Combine the first six ingredients then divide in half 2. Add beef to half of marinade and let it sit at least 1 hour at room temperature 3. Reserve remaining marinade for cooking later 4. Bring water to a boil 5. Add rice, reduce heat to just below medium, and cook 38 min then let it sit 15 min without opening the lid 6. Drain the  meat, discarding marinade 7. Heat oil over med-high heat 1 min then add sesame seeds and continue to heat 1 min more, stirring 8. Add beef to pan and cook, stirring gently, 4 min or so until beef is mostly cooked 9. Combine cornstarch and fresh, unused marinade and pour over cooked beef 10. Cook 1 min, stirring, then remove from heat 11. To partly cooled rice, add soy sauce, vinegar, honey, and ginger 12. Stir 13. To assemble wraps, layer rice, beef, beans, onions, cucumber, carrots, avocado, and cilantro on leaf of lettuce and roll up

1. Brown the sausage and ground meat and drain all the fat 2. Add all the other ingredients for the meat filling and simmer on the stove , uncovered, for about 1 / 2 hour 3. I usually add a bay leaf or two 4. Mix up the cheese filling and set aside in fridge until ready to use 5. Put the noodles in salted water and cook until soft when poked with a fork 6. When the noodles are done  drain the noodles and rinse off with cold water so they can be handled easily 7. Spray the baking pan with a non-stick spray and put a layer of noodles down on the bottom of the pan 8. It is ok to cut some of the noodles to fit into the pan if they do not fit whole 9. Spread half the cheese filling over the noodles, then half of the mozarella cheese on top of that, then half of the meat sauce over the grated mozarella cheese 10. Repeat layers and then top with more mozarella cheese 11. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes 12. Let it stand for 10 minutes before cutting into it 13. Leftovers can be easily stored in the freezer

1. In the frying pan, melt butter 2. Add teaspoons of seasoning and the noodles 3. Saute 2 minutes, stirring 4. Set aside on paper towel 5. Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine coleslaw mix, kernels, green onions, and red bell pepper 6. Toss, cover, and refrigerate 30 minutes to 1 hour before serving 7. In a small bowl, whisk the rest of the ingredients well til syrupy 8. Pour over salad, stir well, and refrigerate 9. Just before serving, stir in noodles 10. Variations: Sub or add toasted, slivered, or chopped almonds in place of or in addition to sunflower kernels 11. For a complete "one-dish" lunch or meal, stir cooked, diced chicken in 2-3 cups

1. Set oven to 350 degrees 2. Butter a 3-quart casserole dish 3. Cook the egg noodles in boiling water with 1 tablespoon salt until al dente 4. Drain then place in a large bowl and toss with 1 tablespoon butter or oil , set aside 5. In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat 6. Add in onion , garlic , bell pepper , celery and jalapeno pepper 7. Saute for 4-5 minutes or until tender 8. Add in soup , half and half or milk , cooked chicken and seaoned salt 9. Bring to a simmer over medium heat stirring with a wooden spoon until heated through and well combined 10. Add the chicken mixture to the cooked noodles in the bowl 11. Toss to combine then season with black pepper to taste and more salt if desired 12. Transfer to a buttered casserole dish 13. In a bowl mix together breadcrumbs with parmesan cheese then sprinkle evenly over casserole 14. Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until heated through and the topping is golden brown

1. In large skillet saut ground chicken / turkey over medium heat , crumbling and cooking until no longer pink 2. Pour into dish , set aside 3. Rinse out pan 4. Saut bell pepper , onion , garlic and ginger for 2 minutes 5. Add meat to pan 6. In small bowl , blend lemon juice , hoisin sauce , brown sugar , sesame oil , soy sauce and hot pepper sauce 7. Pour into pan and stir to coat chicken 8. Reduce heat and simmer , stirring until sauce is absorbed , about 4 minutes 9. Stir in chopped cilantro 10. Serve with lettuce cups

1. Stir together first 12 ingredients in a large bowl , just until combined 2. Shape mixture into 2 loaves 3. Place in an aluminum foil lined broiler pan 4. Pour half of tomato sauce evenly over each loaf , and arrange 2 bacon slices over each loaf 5. Bake at 350f for 1 hour 6. Let meat loaf stand 10 minutes before serving

1. In salad bowl, combine oil, vinegar, garlic, salt, basil, and black pepper 2. Add beans, tuna, scallions, and sweet pepper and toss 3. Chill several hours for flavors to blend 4. To make a beautiful presentation, serve on a leaf of bibb lettuce

1. Brown and crumble sausage in a skillet 2. Wash and chop greens 3. Remove sausage from pan and drain on paper towels 4. Wipe out skillet 5. Heat olive oil in skillet and saute garlic 6. Add greens to skillet 7. Cook uncovered till wilted down 8. Add 1 / 3 cup water to skillet 9. Cook on low heat covered till greens are tender 10. Add the sausage back into the cooked greens 11. Set aside 1 / 2 cup to 1 cup of the greens sausage mixture for the top 12. Mix cottage cheese, ricotta, pesto, and egg together 13. Salt and pepper to taste 14. Line the bottom of a lasagna pan with the lasagna noodles 15. Put half of the sausage / greens mixture on top of noodles followed by ricotta mixture 16. Layer with more lasagna noodles 17. Top with sausage / greens mixture followed by remaining ricotta mixture 18. Place another layer of noodles on top 19. Cover with monzerella cheese , reserved sausage / greens mixture and pine nuts if desired 20. Bake for 1 / 2 hour till melty and bubbly

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees 2. Coat the bottom of the two small or one medium baking dish with a thin layer of alfredo sauce 3. In a medium bowl, mix the pasta, broccoli, mushrooms, chicken, garlic, and alfredo sauce until combined 4. Place mixture into baking dish and top with mozzarella and parmesan cheese 5. Cut the butter into small pieces and scatter on top of the cheese 6. Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is hot and bubbly

1. Put the first 12 ingredients in a large pot 2. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat 3. Reduce heat to a simmer and simmer partly covered for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender 4. Leave veggies whole or use an immersion blender and puree a bit -- leaving some veggie chunks 5. Stir in parsley and season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F 2. Place chicken tenders on a rimmed baking sheet and transfer to oven 3. Bake until very crispy and golden, about 10 minutes beyond recommended bake time on the package 4. Reduce heat to 200 degrees F to keep tenders warm until ready to serve 5. Meanwhile, fill a medium pot fit with a steamer insert with 1-inch of water 6. Place over medium-high heat and when water boils, add broccoli and season with salt 7. Cover, and steam until broccoli is tender, for about 8 minutes 8. Keep warm 9. Place cornstarch in a medium bowl 10. Add rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, honey, chile flakes, and 3 tablespoons of water and whisk to combine 11. Set aside 12. Place a small skillet over medium heat and add sesame oil 13. When shimmering, add garlic and ginger and saute until softened for about 2 minutes 14. Add cornstarch mixture and cook, whisking constantly, until mixture comes to a boil and thickens for about 1-2 minutes 15. Remove from heat and keep warm 16. Remove chicken tenders from oven and transfer to a large mixing bowl 17. Add the broccoli, sauce, and toss to coat 18. Serve with white rice on the side, topped with scallions and toasted sesame seeds

1. In a 13x9 inch casserole dish, layer broccoli, then cheese 2. Mix remaining ingredients together and spoon mixture over the top of the cheese 3. Top with stove top stuffing mix 4. Drizzle with melted margarine 5. Bake at 350 F for 30 minutes

1. Mix together your sweet onion, dill pickle, mayonnaise, and finely chopped lettuce and set aside 2. Fry your eggs until no longer runny and set aside 3. Mix together your ground beef, cajun seasoning and pepper, forming into 8 burgers 4. Fry your burgers until they are no longer pink inside 5. Set aside and place a slice of tomato on top 6. Saute your mushrooms in butter and portion out onto your burgers and immediately top with cheese and your fried egg 7. Top with the slaw toppings 8. If you want, place a bun on top

1. Season one side of the burger with salt, pepper, and garlic 2. Place on grill or in broiler, seasoned side down 3. Season the other side and flip 4. Cook to prefered doneness 5. While burger is cooking, melt butter in fry pan on medium heat 6. Spread mayonnaise onto bread 7. Drop bread, dry side down, onto melted butter and swirl to coat 8. Cover one slice of bread with two slices of swiss cheese and the other with two slices of cheddar 9. In a separate frying pan, melt butter and saute sliced onions 10. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic 11. Place cooked burger patty on top of one cheese-topped slice of bread and the saute onions on the other 12. Carefully assemble and cut sandwich

1. Toast hamburger bun on griddle 2. Cook burger 3. Make thin 4. Sprinkle with lawry's seasoned salt 5. Cook bacon in same pan as burger 6. Put cheese on burger 7. Put bacon on top of cheese until cheese melts 8. Squirt ketchup , mustard on bottom bun 9. Put on onions , pickles , tomato , and lettuce 10. Put cooked burger on top of lettuce 11. On top bun put salad dressing mixed with barbecue sauce

1. For hamburgers: 2. Combine all seasoning ingredrients 3. Use one heaping tblsp of seasoning mix per pound of hamburger meat 4. Mix into hamburger meat until well combined 5. Fry or grill 6. Assembling the complete burger: 7. Heat a large frying pan over medium heat 8. Spread butter on one side of each tortilla 9. Put one tortilla , butter side down in the hot pan 10. Sprinkle the cheeses evenly onto the center of the tortilla in the pan- but not all the way to the edges 11. Put the tomato , onion , bacon and jalapeno over the cheese , add the cooked seasoned burger and cover with the other tortilla butter side up 12. When the bottom is browned , about 45-90 seconds , flip the quesadilla and grill the other side 13. Remove the quesidilla from the pan and using a pizza cutter , cut throught the middle 14. Serve

1. In a 5-quart stainless steel bowl , gently but thoroughly combine the ground beef with the worcestershire sauce , thyme , cumin , and cayenne pepper 2. Gently form the ground beef mixture into eight 4-ounce , 3 / 4-inch-thick patties 3. Use a metal spoon to make a small indentation in the center of 4 of the beef patties 4. Combine the onions and cheddar 5. Divide this mixture into 4 equal portions and place a portion in each indentation 6. Top with another patty and gently form into a burger , making sure to seal all open edges 7. Season the burgers with salt and white pepper 8. Cover the burgers with plastic wrap and refrigerate until needed 9. Grill the burgers over a medium wood or charcoal fire 10. Cook to the desired doneness: about 5-6 minutes on each side for rare , 6-7 minutes on each side for medium , and 9-10 minutes on each side for well-done 11. Remove the burgers from the grill 12. Toast the buns , cut side down , on the grill or griddle or in a nonstick saute pan until golden brown , about 1 minute 13. Spread 1 / 2 tablespoons 14. Mayonnaise onto each burger bun half 15. Place 1 of the lettuce leaves on the bottom half of each bun , then top each with a burger , 2 of the tomato slices , 2 of the papaya slices , and the top half of the bun 16. Serve immediately accompanied by "trini tropical fruit salad"

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees 2. Cut cabbage into thin strips 3. Pour boiling water over porcini mushrooms and let soak for 30 minutes or until softened 4. Drain and chop porcini mushrooms 5. Heat 1 tablespoon of the butter and the oil in a large skillet over moderately low heat 6. Add garlic , mushrooms and rosemary and cook until garlic is golden , about 3 minutes 7. Add cabbage and cook over low heat , covered for 5 minutes 8. Add wine and simmer until the wine is evaporated 9. Add 1 / 4 cup of water and cook over low heat until cabbage is tender , about 6 minutes 10. Discard garlic and rosemary and season cabbage with salt and pepper to taste 11. Melt remaining 4 tablespoons butter over moderately low heat 12. Add flour and cook , stirring for 3 minutes 13. Add milk in a stream , whisking and bring mixture to a boil 14. Simmer for 5 minutes and season with salt and pepper to taste and a pinch of nutmeg 15. Add cabbage to sauce 16. Combine the 2 cheese 17. Spread one-third of the cabbage mixture in the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan 18. Arrange half of the lasagne in one layer on top of the cabbage and top with half the remaining cabbage mixture and half of the cheese mixture 19. Arrange the remaining lasagne over the cheese and top with the remaining cabbage mixture and cheese 20. Bake in the middle of the over for 25-30 minutes or until bubbling

1. If you have the cabbage heads frozen , just put under running luke warm water and peel them off and dry them with paper towels 2. Mix the meat ingredients in a bowl with your hands until well blended 3. Place the leaves on a flat surface , i used a large cutting board and place a "meatball" amount in a leaf 4. Roll it until just covered and then fold in the sides and finish rolling and place in a large pot , seam side down 5. Continue until all is used up 6. Place the sliced onions on top of the cabbage rolls in the pot 7. In a bowl mix all the sauce ingredients and pour over the onions 8. Bring the pot to a boil and then lower the heat , cover and simmer for an hour and a half

1. Begin boiling noodles 2. Place chopped cabbage / kale into a stock pot and saute with soy sauce , garlic , sesame oil and chili pepper flakes until your cabbage is clear or kale has wilted 3. Immediately add the chicken soup stock and bring to boil 4. Reduce heat and add in sweet chili sauce to taste 5. (if you want a big kick 6. Add in chicken or beef 7. Do not add shrimp or tofu at this step 8. Bring back to a simmer 9. Beat egg , then stream into soup 10. After 15 minutes add in noodls 11. Finally , add tofu or shrimp 12. Top with scallions and salt and pepper as desire

1. Read the method from start to finish and then choose and prep your ingredients 2. Curry base: shake the can of coconut milk or stir it well 3. In a 3-4 qt saucepan or wok over medium heat , simmer 1 / 2 cup of coconut milk , stirring occasionally until reduced by half 4. It will get very thick and shiny and may or may not separate-either is fine 5. Add your choice of curry paste , whisk well and cook , continuing to whisk , for 1 minute 6. Whisk in the broth and the remaining coconut milk 7. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat 8. Aromatics / simmer: add your choice of aromatics , proteins , vegetables and fruits as well as the brown sugar and fish sauces to the simmering sauce 9. Be aware that some ingredients take longer than others to cook 10. Add the ingredients in stages , as listed in the next step 11. When the aromatics are added , also add your choices of chicken , pork , carrots , onions , eggplant , green beans , chinese long beans and kabocha squash 12. Two minutes later , add your choices of beef , large shrimp , tofu , asparagus , mushrooms , baby corn , green papaya , cabbage , bell peppers , and sugar snap peas 13. One minute later , add your choices of scallops and firm white fish 14. One minute later , add your choice of squid , cherry tomatoes , bamboo shoots , snow peas , pineapple and bok choy 15. Cook for one to two minutes more and check for doneness 16. The meat , chicken or seafood should be cooked through and the vegetables should be tender-crisp 17. Remove the curry from the heat and season to taste with the brown sugar and fish sauce 18. Add a stir-in of your choice 19. Transfer to a serving bowl or serve right from the pot 20. Remove the aromatics before serving or tell the guests to eat around them 21. Serve with your choice of garnishes 22. The curry can be eaten as is or served with hot cooked rice

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f 2. Add pork , water or chicken stock , and 1 tablespoon salt to a large dutch oven with a tight fitting lid 3. Liquid should just cover meat 4. Add additional as necessary 5. Place over medium-high heat and bring to a boil 6. Transfer to oven and cook , about 3 -4 hours , until meat is very tender and liquid is reduced to 1 cup 7. Baste meat every 45 minutes with cooking liquid 8. Increase heat to 400 degrees f 9. Remove pot from oven and drain all but 3 tablespoons fat from pot 10. Add cumin , cloves , cayenne , and 2 teaspoons black pepper 11. Stir to combine , and return to oven 12. Roast , stirring after 10 minutes , until meat is browned , crisp , and liquid is evaporated , about 20 minutes more 13. If meat is very fatty , you may need to continue to drain fat as pork crisps 14. Season to taste with salt and and pepper , and serve in tortillas , with cabbage , sour cream , pickled red onions , cilantro , avocado and serranos chiles

1. In 1 / 4 cup butter , saute carrots , onion , celery and broccoli stems for 5 minutes 2. Add thyme , oregano and basil 3. Saute 5 minutes more 4. Add wine and deglaze pan 5. Add hot chicken stock and reduce by one-third 6. Add worcestershire sauce , tabasco , smoked chicken , beans and broccoli florets 7. Simmer 5 minutes 8. Add cream , simmer 5 minutes more and season to taste 9. Drop in remaining butter , piece by piece , stirring until melted and serve immediately 10. Smoked chicken: on a covered grill , slightly smoke boneless chicken , cooking to medium rare 11. Chef meskan uses applewood chips and does not allow the grill to become too hot

1. Slice eggplant crosswise , sprinkle with a little salt , toss in a colander , and let drain for 20 minutes 2. Rinse and pat dry 3. Heat oil in a dutch oven , over medium-low heat 4. Add onions , carrot , peppers , eggplant , chicken , and lamb 5. Cover with water , bring to a boil , season with salt and pepper , cover , reduce heat and let simmer 45 minutes 6. Add tomatoes and green beans , cover , and simmer 30 minutes 7. Meanwhile , prepare the couscous: melt butter in a sauce pan over medium-low heat 8. Cook the shallots until translucent , about 3 minutes 9. Add stock , season with 1 / 2 teaspoon each salt and pepper and bring to a boil 10. Stir in couscous , being careful that no clumps form , cover , remove from heat and let sit 10 minutes 11. Add artichokes and chickpeas to the stew snd heat through 12. To serve: pile couscous in the center of a serving platter in a cone shape 13. Spoon stew around couscous

1. Preheat an oven to 400f 2. In a large saucepan over medium heat , melt the butter 3. Add the flour and cook , stirring constantly , until the mixture smells fragrant and nutty , 1 to 2 minutes 4. Slowly add the broth , whisking until smooth , and bring to a boil 5. Add the thyme , bay leaf , shallot , celery , carrots , mushroom , peas , potatoes , and chicken 6. Sea salt and pepper 7. Simmer , covered until the potatoes are tender , 10-15 minutes 8. Thicken with cornstarch if necessary 9. Remove bay leaf and discard 10. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes 11. Add heavy cream 12. Divide the filling among 4 ovenproof ramekins and place on a baking sheet 13. Brush the puff pastry squares with the egg mixture 14. Brush the rims of the bowls with water 15. Place 1 pastry square on top of each bowl , pressing lightly on the edges 16. Bake until the pastry is puffed and golden brown , about 15-20 minutes 17. Remove from oven 18. Let rest for 5-10 minutes before serving 19. Serves 4

1. Preheat the oven to 350 2. Line two 9-cup muffin pans with baking liners 3. Using an electric mixer , beat the brown sugar and eggs at high speed for 5 minutes 4. Add the oil and 2 tablespoons water 5. Beat at medium speed until blended 6. Mix in the pumpkin pie spice , baking powder and baking soda 7. Mix in the flour at low speed 8. Stir in the carrots 9. Fill each muffin cup halfway with batter and bake until golden , about 20 minutes 10. Let cool 11. Using the electric mixer , beat the butter and confectioners' sugar for 5 minutes 12. Add in the marshmallow cream and vanilla and mix until combined 13. Spread on the cupcakes

1. Saute onion , garlic& carrot in olive oil over medium heat until tender 2. Add ground beef and brown until no longer pink 3. Add oregano , basil , garlic powder , parsley flakes , salt& pepper & worcestershire sauce 4. Add merlot wine , simmer a few minutes 5. Add rest of ingredients and stir well 6. Reduce heat to low and simmer for at least 5 hours stirring occasionally 7. Remove bay leaves 8. Serve over cooked spaghetti noodles

1. Chop cauliflower & green beans into bite sized pieces & boil separately for 3-5 minutes or until tender 2. Set aside 3. Saute onion in oil , 3-5 minutes over medium heat , until soft 4. Add curry , ginger , & cayenne , if desired 5. Stir about one minute , keeping the heat on medium 6. Add broth , salt & corn starch 7. The sauce should be about the consistency of milk 8. Add cooked vegetables , beans , and tomatoes 9. Turn heat up to medium-high 10. Cook for about 5 minutes , stirring constantly 11. Add chili sauce & cook 1-2 minutes more 12. The sauce should be nice and thick 13. Serve over hot basmati with mango chutney

1. Steam the vegetables , covered 2 minutes 2. Rinse under cold water 3. Drain well 4. Combine spices in a skillet over medium heat and cook 2 minutes stirring constantly 5. In a medium bowl , combine spice mixture , sour cream , vinegar , and honey 6. Add vegetables and mix well

1. Preheated oven to 450 degrees 2. Rinse cut cauliflower and do not dry 3. Mix oil , rosemary , saffron , salt , pepper and garlic together 4. Let sit for 5 minutes 5. Pour over cauliflower and toss to coat 6. Place in a large cookie sheet pan in one layer 7. Roast for 15 minutes 8. Give a toss and bake for 15 more minutes , toss and then an other 15 minutes , till crisp edges and tender 9. Do roast for an other 15 minutes if more tenderness is desired 10. Remove cauliflower and place in serving bowl 11. Remove garlic and herbs and place in blender or small food processor with 1 / 4 cup olive oil and lemon juice 12. Pulse till smooth 13. Pour over cauliflower and watch it disappear 14. Or place in a bowl for dipping or spread on crisp bread

1. Wash and chop the cauliflower into small pieces 2. Steam in vegetable steamer or microwave until tender 3. Drain cauliflower well 4. Place in bowl and mash with potato masher until crumbly 5. Add remaining ingredients and mix well 6. Season to taste 7. Spread filling onto whole wheat vegan bread or stuff into pita 8. Garnish with tomato slices 9. Enjoy !

1. Cook the cauliflower by steaming or boiling until just tender 2. Do not overcook ! drain and set aside 3. Mix the garlic with the tahini , cumin and lemon juice 4. Season with salt , pepper and hot pepper sauce 5. At this point the mixture is a dense thick paste 6. Add a little water , tablespoon by tablespoon , until the mixture is creamy , then mix with the cauliflower 7. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve 8. At serving time , garnish with a sprinkle of paprika , chopped parsley / cilantro and / or lemon wedges

1. Spray oven-proof skillet with cooking spray and pre-heat oven to 350 degrees 2. Prepare ramen noodles according to directions 3. Drain noodles and spread into the bottom of skillet 4. In mixing bowl , beat eggs 5. Stir in pepper , olives , italian seasoning , and garlic powder 6. Pour egg mixture over noodles 7. Place pepperoni slices evenly over eggs and noodles 8. Bake in oven for 15 minutes 9. Remove skillet from oven 10. Top with mozzarella cheese and tomato slices 11. Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and eggs are done

1. Adjust an oven rack to middle postition 2. Grease a 13x9 in baking dish and set aside 3. Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees 4. Bring 4 qts water to boil in large pot 5. Add pasta and 1 tsp of salt and cook, stirring often, according to package directions 6. Drain pasta and transfer to baking dish 7. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat 8. Brown beef and sausage until no longer pink- drain excess grease 9. Add celery , onion , bell pepper , mushrooms and 1 tsp of salt and cook, stirring ocassionally, until softened for 5 to 7 minutes 10. Stir in garlic, oregano, pepper flakes, and 1 tsp of pepper and cook until fragrant for about 30 seconds 11. Stir in tomato sauce and diced tomatoes, bring to a simmer and cook until flavors are blended, for about 5 minutes stir in parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste 12. Set aside, off heat 13. Sprinkle 1 cup of cheese evenly over pasta 14. Then pour meat mixture on top of this 15. Then sprinkle reamaining 1 cup of cheese evenly on top of meat mixture 16. Place baking dish on a baking sheet , covering with foil 17. Bake in the pre-heated oven about 45 minutes , until sauce is bubbling 18. Remove foil and bake another 15 minutes , until top is spotty brown 19. Cool 5-10 minutes before serving 20. Enjoy

1. Heat oven to 400 degrees f 2. In 8" cast iron skillet over medium heat , cook bacon until crisp 3. Transfer to paper towles to drain 4. Crumble 5. Remove all but 1 1 / 2 teaspoons bacon drippings 6. Brush sides and bottom of pan with remaining drippings 7. Place skillet in over for 5 minutes 8. Meanwhile , in medium bowl , stir together cornbread mix , mexicorn , jalepeno , egg , cheese , milk , and bacon until combined 9. Spoon batter into heated skillet and bake 15 minutes , or until golden 10. Trade the jalapenos and cheese for fillings that taste best with your summer feast 11. Garlic lover ? stir 2oz shredded provolone cheese , 1tsp 12. Italian seasoning , and 1 clove minced garlic into batter until just combined 13. Like it hot ? stir 2 oz diced or shredded pepper jack cheese , 1 / 2 teaspoons southwest chipotle seasoning , and 1 tsp whole mexican oregano , , into batter until just combined 14. Subtle more your style ? stir 2oz shredded gruyere cheese , 1tsp 15. Herbes de provence and 1 / 2 teaspoons seasoned pepper blend into batter until just combined

1. Prepare pasta noodles according to package directions , adding peas for the last 5 minutes of cooking 2. Drain 3. Immediately return pasta and peas to pan 4. Add remaining ingredients , tossing well until cheese is melted

1. Preheat oven to 350 2. Butter a shallow 1 1 / 2 quart baking dish , and add cooked pasta 3. In a blender or food processor combine egg , milk , and garlic , and process 3 seconds 4. Add onion , cheeses , peppers , salt , and paprika , and blend about 10 seconds 5. Turn into dish , folding into pasta 6. Casserole could be covered with plastic wrap and refrigerated up to 24 hours at this point 7. To bake , bring casserole close to room temperature 8. Melt butter in a small saucepan 9. Coat crackers with butter and spread over top of casserole 10. Bake about 20 to 25 minutes , or until thick yet creamy 11. If top is not golden , slip under broiler for a minute 12. Remove from oven , let stand about 5 minutes , and serve 13. Enjoy !

1. Cut up chicken and add cumin , taco seasoning salt + pepper , paprika , and adobo , set to the side 2. Cook rice according to the directions on the box 3. In a large saute or frying pan on med-high heat , estimate and add 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil 4. Add chicken 5. While chicken is cooking , peel avacados and make guacamole according to package directions 6. Refrigerate 7. Open cans of black beans , corn , diced tomatoes with chiles and cilantro and put in small bowls 8. If you'd like , you can warm , the can of beans and corn 9. Don't warm the can of diced tomatoes , unless you like warm salsa / tomato mixture 10. Once chicken and rice is done , you can start plating 11. Letting everyone add the toppings of their choice is part of the fun of the meal ! 12. P 13. S 14. Suggestion for plating - put shredded lettuce in bowl or plate first - then add rice , then chicken , then toppings

1. In a saucepan , add oil and 2 tablespoons of butter 2. Let melt and then add chicken breasts 3. Cook until golden brown and juices run clear 4. While chicken is cooking , follow package directions for rice 5. In saucepan deglaze pan with wine 6. Don't get rid of those yummy brown bits--it gives this sauce flavor 7. Add garlic , cream of mushroom soup and milk 8. Stir until creamy 9. Add cheese 10. When rice is cooked , pour into mushroom mixture 11. Add chicken and season with salt and pepper 12. Let cook for another 5 minutes 13. Serve with salad and garlic bread 14. Serves 4 15. You can also leave the rice separate and just put the chicken in the sauce--either way , it's your choice

1. Season flour with paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper 2. Dredge chicken pieces in flour shaking off excess 3. Heat oil in frying pan and brown chicken on both sides 4. Meanwhile, make sauce 5. Mix mushroom soup, chicken broth, orange juice, white wine, ginger, and brown sugar together 6. Season to taste with salt, and freshly ground pepper 7. Place browned chicken in large oven proof dish and pour sauce over and add the carrots, celery, and mushroom 8. Cook in a 350 oven for 1 hour until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked thorougly

1. Saute onion, garlic, and celery together until limp 2. Add carrots, and saute a few minutes 3. Add in spaghetti sauce and stock 4. Bring to a boil 5. Add seasonings 6. Add noodles, broken up, and peas and corn 7. Boil until noodles are almost done 8. Add red pepper and cook thorougly 9. Serve hot with buns

1. Slice the chicken and place in a bowl 2. Peel and crush the garlic , mix with the soya yogurt and turmeric and pour over the chicken 3. Cover and leave to marinate in the fridge for at least 4 hours or overnight if possible 4. Peel and slice the onions and place in a pan with the stock 5. Cover the pan , bring to the boil and cook for 10 minutes 6. Reduce the heat , uncover and cook gently for 20 minutes until the onions are tender and golden 7. Finely chop ginger and crush coriander seeds 8. Add all the spices to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes 9. Then add the chicken and soya yogurt marinade 10. Cover and simmer very gently over a low heat for 15 minutes until the chicken is cooked 11. Season with salt and pepper 12. Serve immediately with freshly chopped coriander

1. Chop veggies / herbs coarsely and then fry in 1 t butter or oil 2. Add rice and stir to coat and then add broth , salt and lime juice 3. Bring to rapid boil , turn down as low as possible , cover and simmer about 20 minutes - do not stir ! fluff with fork

1. Begin boiling noodles 2. Place chopped cabbage / kale into a stock pot and saute with soy sauce , garlic , sesame oil and chili pepper flakes until your cabbage is clear or kale has wilted 3. Immediately add the chicken soup stock and bring to boil 4. Reduce heat and add in sweet chili sauce to taste 5. (if you want a big kick 6. Add in chicken or beef 7. Do not add shrimp or tofu at this step 8. Bring back to a simmer 9. Beat egg , then stream into soup 10. After 15 minutes add in noodls 11. Finally , add tofu or shrimp 12. Top with scallions and salt and pepper as desire

1. Wrap tortillas in foil 2. Bake at 375f 10-15 minutes or until soft and heated through 3. Can also be wrapped in plastic wrap and microwaved for 1-2 minutes on high until soft 4. While tortillas heat , saute zucchini , onion and canned chilies in oil for three minutes on medium heat 5. Reduce heat to low , add water and salsa , cover and cook for three minutes 6. Stir in almonds 7. Remove from heat 8. Spoon 1 / 2 cup vegetable mixture down center of each tortilla 9. Divide cheese into sixths and sprinkle on top of vegetable mixture 10. Roll up tortillas 11. Place burritos on serving dish and spoon 1 tbsp sour cream and 1 tbsp salsa down length of each burrito 12. Garnish burritos with reserved almonds 13. Serve immediately 14. If desired serve with shredded lettuce , chopped tomatoes and sliced avacado on the side 15. Refried beans and spanish rice are also nice side dishes to go with the burritos and makes for a full course meal 16. Enjoy !

1. Place roast beef in saucepan and mash with fork 2. Mix in green chiles , garlic powder , chili powder , ground cumin , , beef broth and wondra flour 3. Bring to boil and simmer 2 minutes 4. Place refried beans in a microwave safe bowl , cover with plastic wrap and heat in microwave about 2 - 3 minutes or until heated through 5. Heat tortillas separately over open flame on stove , turning frequently until heated through or heat on griddle or frying pan , turning once 6. Place warmed tortilla on plate and spread with refried beans 7. Remove a serving of beef from saucepan with slotted spoon and place over refried beans 8. Top with shredded cheese 9. Fold sides of tortillas in about 2 inches 10. Roll the burrito , starting with the side closest to you and roll away from you 11. Ladle some beef & green chile sauce over burrito and top with cheese 12. Garnish with a dollup of sour cream

1. Cook onions , carrots and garlic in cooking oil until tender-crisp 2. In a large deep skillet , brown meat and drain fat 3. Add cooked vegetable mixture and seasonings to cooked meat 4. Cook and stir 1 minute 5. Add remaining ingredients except for cheese 6. Bring to a boil , reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes , stirring occasionally 7. Serve topped with cheese

1. Preheat broiler 2. Combine all ingredients , except butter and flour 3. Bring to a boil 4. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes 5. Blend melted butter with the flour to make a roux 6. Add roux to the corn and mix well 7. Remove from heat 8. Pour into a casserole dish 9. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese 10. Broil until cheese is nicely browned

1. Mix together the corn , sour cream , and mayonnaise 2. Slice the lime in half and squeeze the juice from one half over corn mixture 3. Mix well 4. Chop the cilantro and green onions 5. Add to the corn mixture 6. Blend in the cumin and cayenne pepper 7. Mix in shredded cheese 8. Refrigerate overnight 9. Serve with tortilla chips

1. In a two quart saucepan with tight-fitting lid , heat one tablespoon of the olive oil , then saute the onion over medium heat until very golden and soft 2. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for a minute , then add the paprika , black pepper , allspice and cayenne and cook for a minute more 3. Wash the millet quickly and drain 4. Add the millet to the pan and stir , coating the grains and cooking until hot to the touch 5. Add the water and salt and bring to a boil , then reduce the heat and cover 6. Simmer on low for 20 minutes before checking for doneness 7. When all the liquid is absorbed and the grain is tender , cover and take the pan off the heat for 10 minutes to steam 8. Scrape the cooked millet into a bowl and cover , then let cool 9. Whisk the remaining two tablespoons olive oil with the lemon juice and brown sugar in a small bowl 10. Stir the corn , bell pepper , tomato and parsley into the cooled millet mixture , then drizzle the dressing over it and stir to coat 11. Serve topped with the peanuts

1. Fry bacon in a dutch over until crisp 2. Remove bacon , reserving 2 tablespoons drippings 3. Crumble bacon and st aside 4. Saute onion in reserve drippings until tender 5. Add potatoes and water 6. Cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender 7. Stir in milk , corn , salt , and peper to taste 8. Continue to cook , stirring frequently , until heated through 9. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon to serve

1. Make enchilada gravy sauce 2. Heat oil in large stockpot 3. Add flour and cook until browned , stirring constantly , you are making a roux , do not let it burn 4. Stir in chili powder , cumin , garlic , salt and pepper 5. Cook roux , stirring constantly , for at least 2-3 minutes 6. If you do not thoroughly cook the roux it will taste like flour mixed with oil 7. Gradually add the water , stirring until smooth 8. Boil gently for 15 minutes 9. Meanwhile make the chili con carne 10. Brown the ground beef in a large skillet 11. Add the garlic , cumin , bay leaf , salt and pepper 12. Cook for 15 minutes , stirring occasionally and adding a little water if the pan becomes dry 13. Add the chili powder and 1 cup of water and bring to a simmer 14. Simmer for 10 minutes , then remove the bay leaf and add the beans if using 15. Meanwhile make the enchiladas 16. Preheat oven to 350f 17. Soften tortillas , fill with american cheese and roll up 18. Place them seam side down in a baking dish and cover with enchilada gravy sauce and chili con carne 19. Top with pico de gallo and more cheese to taste 20. Heat in oven for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and enchiladas are heated through

1. Blend cream cheese and mayo until creamy 2. Add lemon juice , tabasco , and scallions 3. Mix 4. Add old bay , salt , pepper and crab meat 5. Mix 6. Put in baking dish and top with parmesan cheese 7. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes , until cheese starts to brown 8. Can be refrigerated up to 24 hours before cooking

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees 2. Grease an 8 inch square pan 3. Layer 4 of the quartered tortillas covering the bottom of pan completely 4. Combine peppers , crab , 1 c 5. Cheese , onion , and the cilantro 6. Whisk together cream and eggs: stir into crab mixture 7. Add salt and pepper to taste 8. Pour over tortillas 9. Top with remaining quartered tortillas and remaining cheese 10. Bake for 45 minutes

1. Bring milk , half and half , and heavy whipping cream to a boil 2. Add crab meat , fresh parsley , old bay seasoning , butter , salt and pepper 3. When it starts to boil , make a paste of cornstarch and water and add to thicken soup 4. To serve , sprinkle each serving with a bit of old bay and chopped parsley 5. Serve with oyster crackers and a small cream pitcher of sherry on the side for diners to add to taste

1. Heat oil and butter in large skillet over medium heat 2. Add garlic and cook until garlic is lightly golden 3. Add red pepper , lemon juice and white wine 4. Bring to a soft boil and simmer for 2-3 minutes 5. Gently stir in crabmeat and parsley 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste 7. Serve over pasta 8. Save about 1 / 2 to 1 cup of pasta water to add to dish if there is not enough liquid to suit you or you could also add additional amount of wine or chicken broth

1. Combine lemon dill sauce ingredients and chill 2. Saute the scallions , garlic , and parsley in a tablespoon of melted butter over medium heat until wilted 3. In a large mixing bowl , combine the eggs , worcestershire sauce , dijon mustard , salt , pepper , 1 / 2 cup cracker crumbs , grated parmesan , and mayonnaise 4. Fold in the crabmeat 5. Shape into 8 crab cakes and coat in remaining cracker crumbs 6. Place crab cakes on a buttered baking pan 7. Melt butter and mix with lemon juice 8. Drizzle 1 / 2 of lemon butter over crab cakes 9. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees 10. Drizzle remaining lemon butter over crab cakes and broil for 2 minutes until slightly browned 11. Serve with lemon dill sauce

1. In a pot , cover carrots with water to cover 2. Bring to a boil , then lower heat 3. Simmer 10 minutes or until just tender 4. While simmering carrots , pour contents of can of tomatoes into a bowl and squish into little pieces with your hands 5. Wash hands 6. Blend chili powder , cumin , oregano , and cayenne into tomatoes 7. Take the 2 tbs of flour and blend with 1 / 4 cup cold water in a small cup 8. Pour this into tomato mixture and stir to blend 9. Drain carrots , and cut into 3 / 4 in pieces 10. Put both aside for now 11. Melt butter on medium heat in a large fring pan 12. Add onion , mushrooms , zucchini , celery , green pepper , and garlic and saute 13. Stir continuously until onion is limp 14. Stir tomato mixture into frying pan and bring to a simmer 15. Cover and simmer for 2 or 3 minutes , then uncover and cook for about 5 minutes over med-high heat until liquid has evaporated 16. Stir in carrots and cheese 17. Salt to taste 18. When cheese has melted put pan in refrigerator to quickly cool vegetables 19. Stir now and then to help cool faster 20. Now , begin empanada crust 21. Resift flour with baking powder in a bowl 22. Quickly cut butter and shortening into bowl until it looks like a coarse meal 23. Make a well in the center 24. Add soy sauce and cold water together 25. Stir vigorously with a fork until dough follows the fork around bowl 26. Personal observation: the dough seems rather"frothy" at this point 27. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently for about 10 folds to remove stickyness 28. Divide dough into 8 equal pieces 29. Make into a ball and roll into an 8 inch circle 30. Spoon about 3 / 4 cup vegetable filling onto center of circle 31. Moisten edges of circle with water and bring together at top , pinching and fluting edges 32. Mine looked like balls of dough and turned out fine 33. Lift empanada onto ungreased cookie sheet 34. Repeat until done 35. If you fill more than one cookie sheet put the full one in the refrigerator 36. When done , prick the top of each empanada with a fork and brush with egg and water mixture 37. If you are going to cook some of them right away , pre-heat oven to 400 and cook 25 to 30 minutes on an ungreased cookie sheet 38. Take the ones for later and freeze uncovered on cookie sheet overnight 39. When frozen solid wrap in foil or put in freezer bags 40. Label with instructions: bake uncovered in pre-heated 425 degree oven for 30 minutes 41. Let cool some before serving

1. Beat the eggs lightly and add the milk 2. Combine the flour , sugar and salt 3. Stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture , stirring in the cup of cream as you mix 4. Fry the apple slices in butter in a skillet 5. Preheat oven to 500 degree 6. Cover the bottom of an oven-proof baking dish , or heavy skillet , with apples 7. Pour the batter over slices and bake in a preheated 500 oven 8. When nearly done , remove from oven and sprinkle here and there with a mixture of sugar and cinnamon to taste 9. Place dabs of butter on the pancake and return to oven until browned 10. Just before serving , sprinkle with lemon juice , and cut into triangles

1. Cook's 2. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f 3. Grease 2 round cake pans 4. As the oven preheats , begin to make the cake batter 5. Dissolve the cocoa into the espresso 6. Stir the buttermilk into the cocoa mixture and set aside to cool 7. Whisk together the flour , baking soda and salt 8. In another bowl , beat the butter with an electric mixer at medium speed for about 6 minutes , while gradually adding the sugar 9. The butter mixture should be light and fluffy 10. Slowly add the eggs and vanilla to the butter , while continuing to beat 11. Be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl as you go , so all the ingredients get incorporated 12. Fold the flour and cocoa mixtures into the butter mixture with a rubber spatula , alternating from flour to cocoa in the following order: 1 / 3 flour mixture 13. 1 / 2 cocoa mixture 14. 1 / 3 flour mixture 15. 1 / 2 cocoa mixture 16. 1 / 3 flour mixture 17. Do not overmix ! 18. Pour half of the finished batter into each of the cake pans and level the tops with the spatula 19. Bake for 30-40 minutes in the center of the oven , rotating halfway through 20. Check with a wooden toothpick for doneness 21. Cool for at least 15 minutes before inverting onto a baking rack to cool completely 22. Make the buttercream: with an electric mixer beat the peanut butter and butter in a large bowl until creamy 23. Add the powdered sugar and beat until spreadable 24. With a serrated knife halve the two layers making 4 25. Place 1 cake layer top down on the rack and spread 1 / 3 of the buttercream to the edges of the layer 26. Top the first cake layer with another and repeat with the buttercream 27. Continue layering with the remaining layers and buttercream , ending with cake 28. Refrigerate covered in plastic wrap for at least 3 hours and up to overnight 29. Remove the cake from the refrigerator and carefully transfer to a wire rack over a sheet pan 30. To make the ganache , chop the butter and scatter it into the chocolate pieces in a large bowl 31. Heat the cream and corn syrup in a saucepan over moderate heat 32. As soon as the cream mixture begins to boil , pour it over the chocolate mixture and begin stirring vigorously 33. When the chocolate has melted and is combined thoroughly with the cream , stir in the vanilla 34. Quickly begin pouring the ganache over the top of the cake , allowing it to flow down and cover the sides 35. Pack the chopped peanuts onto the ganache to cover the sides of the cake , leaving the chocolate on top exposed 36. Store in the refrigerator 37. Serving suggestions: i like to reserve a little of the buttercream and a handful of whole honey roasted peanuts to decorate the top of the cake 38. Try using a star 39. Then , set peanuts into the buttercream border to form an interesting design

1. Preheat the oven to 200 celsius / 395 fahrenheit 2. Rinse the corn in cold water 2-3 times and drain 3. Puree corn , apple juice and 1 egg until smooth 4. The puree will smell strongly of corn , but don't worry 5. The cake won't taste like this 6. In a blender , whisk egg whites until very stiff 7. Meanwhile , transfer the corn to a bowl and add oats 8. Add baking powder , vanilla and spices to the corn / oat mixture and stir very well 9. The dough will have a thick oatmeal-like texture 10. If you want , you can add 1 tsp of peanut butter for extra flavour 11. Cut the banana into coins and each coin into approximately 6 pieces 12. Chop the walnuts 13. Add banana and walnuts to the corn / oat mixture 14. Use a big flat spoon and scoop an amount equal of 4 tablespoons of the very stiff egg whites into the corn / oat mixture and stir until even 15. Add the corn / oat mixture to the remaining egg whites , but don't stir until even 16. Just mix lightly 17. There will be puffs of egg white here and there 18. Add baking sheets to a 10x20 square baking tray or any other equally sized heat resistant tray you may have in handy 19. Pour the thick mixture into the tray and bake for 15 minutes 20. Done ! your fluffy , spicy , moist , sweet , delicious and incredibly healthy cake is ready !

1. Preheat oven to 350f spray an 8x8 inch non-stick cake pan with cooking spray 2. In a medium mixing bowl , using a sturdy whisk or spatula , mix the applesauce , vanilla , egg whites and sugar until they are well combined 3. Add the flour , cocoa powder , espresso powder , baking powder , and salt 4. Stir the until just combined and no lumps remain 5. Pour into prepared pan 6. Sprinkle the chocolate chips chips evenly over the top 7. Bake for 20-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out dry 8. Transfer the pan to a cooling rack and allow them to cool 5 minutes 9. Cut into 12 equal brownies

1. Preheat oven to 350 dg 2. Peel eggplants , slice , sprinkle lightly with garlic salt and set aside about 15 minutes on paper towels 3. Saute onion in 1 t butter or oil , add ham and wine , and cook until wine nearly evaporates 4. Add tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes 5. Meanwhile , pat eggplant dry , dust with flour and fry in 2 t butter or oil until golden 6. Drain 7. Layer eggplant , then a portion of ham mixture , another layer of eggplant , etc 8. In greased casserole dish and cover with parmesan cheese 9. Bake at 350 dg 10. For 30 minutes

1. Butter a large baking dish 2. Set aside 3. Sprinkle both sides of eggplant slices with salt 4. Let stand 1 hour 5. Rinse and pat dry with paper towels 6. In buttered dish , arrange eggplant slices , potatoes , zucchini , dill and parsley 7. Preheat oven to 350f 8. Heat oil in a medium skillet 9. Add onion and garlic , saute until transparent 10. Stir into eggplant mixture 11. Stir in salt , pepper , and broth 12. Cover and bake 45 minutes 13. In a small bowl , combine breadcrumbs and 1 tbsp cheese 14. After baking eggplant mixture 45 minutes , stir tomatoes and crumb mixture into vegetable mixture 15. Bake 15 minutes longer or until tomatoes are cooked 16. Sprinkle with remaining cheese 17. Serve hot

1. For sauce : 2. In a dutch oven or large size sauce pan , add oil , on medium heat 3. Add garlic and onions , saut' until tender 4. Add tomato sauce , tomato paste , and wine , if using , and italian seasoning 5. Mix well , and bring to a boil , then reduce heat to a simmer 6. Cover and simmer for 4 4 1 / 2 hours , stirring occasionally 7. For eggplant: 8. In a large size skillet , add olive oil 9. Heat on medium 10. Peel eggplant , then slice them into 1 / 4" round disks 11. In two small bowls or pie plates , add bread crumbs to one , and eggs and milk to the other , beat egg mixture well 12. Dip each eggplant disk into egg mixture then into bread crumbs , coat completely 13. Place gently into hot oil 14. Fry to a golden brown on both sides , drain on paper towels 15. Repeat until all the eggplant are breaded and fried to a golden brown 16. Set aside 17. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f 18. Assemble: 19. In a 13x9x2 ungreased baking dish , add about 1 to1 cups sauce to bottom of pan , spread sauce evenly in baking dish 20. Cover sauce with one even layer of breaded eggplant , spread 1 cup mozzarella cheese evenly over eggplant , sprinkle with 1 / 3 cup parmesan cheese 21. Repeat two more times , ending with parmesan cheese 22. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes 23. Let set for 10 minutes before cutting 24. Cut into 8 pieces 25. Serve hot

1. Place the pepper and the sliced onion on foil lined baking sheet 2. Spray the onions with a tiny bit of garlic flavored cooking spray 3. Broil until peppers' skin is blackened 4. Let cool and peel the peppers 5. In the meantime , grill the zucchini on george forman grill until it has black marks 6. Set aside 7. Brush the eggplant slices with marinade and place on grill , cook until it has black marks on it 8. Chop all vegetables into bite sized pieces 9. Spray a large skillet with garlic no stick cooking spray 10. Heat to medium 11. Place one of the tortillas in the skillet to soften 12. Layer half of ingredients in tortilla , roll up and and place in skillet 13. Brown on all sides and serve with 2 tablespoons fat free sour cream 14. Repeat with remaining ingredients 15. Enjoy

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees 2. Brush 2 baking sheets with oil 3. Set aside 4. In a wide , shallow bowl , whisk together eggs and 2 tablespoons water 5. In another bowl , combine breadcrumbs , 3 / 4 cup parmesan , oregano , and basil 6. Season with salt and pepper 7. Dip eggplant slices in egg mixture , letting excess drip off , then dredge in breadcrumb mixture , coating well 8. Place on baking sheets 9. Bake until golden brown on bottom , 20 to 25 minutes 10. Turn slices 11. Continue baking until browned on other side , 20 to 25 minutes more 12. Remove from oven 13. Raise oven heat to 400 degrees 14. Spread 2 cups sauce in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish 15. Arrange half the eggplant in dish 16. Cover with 2 cups sauce , then 1 / 2 cup mozzarella 17. Repeat with remaining eggplant , sauce , and mozzarella 18. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons parmesan 19. Bake until sauce is bubbling and cheese is melted , 15 to 20 minutes 20. Let stand 5 minutes before serving

1. Read the method from start to finish and then choose and prep your ingredients 2. Curry base: shake the can of coconut milk or stir it well 3. In a 3-4 qt saucepan or wok over medium heat , simmer 1 / 2 cup of coconut milk , stirring occasionally until reduced by half 4. It will get very thick and shiny and may or may not separate-either is fine 5. Add your choice of curry paste , whisk well and cook , continuing to whisk , for 1 minute 6. Whisk in the broth and the remaining coconut milk 7. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat 8. Aromatics / simmer: add your choice of aromatics , proteins , vegetables and fruits as well as the brown sugar and fish sauces to the simmering sauce 9. Be aware that some ingredients take longer than others to cook 10. Add the ingredients in stages , as listed in the next step 11. When the aromatics are added , also add your choices of chicken , pork , carrots , onions , eggplant , green beans , chinese long beans and kabocha squash 12. Two minutes later , add your choices of beef , large shrimp , tofu , asparagus , mushrooms , baby corn , green papaya , cabbage , bell peppers , and sugar snap peas 13. One minute later , add your choices of scallops and firm white fish 14. One minute later , add your choice of squid , cherry tomatoes , bamboo shoots , snow peas , pineapple and bok choy 15. Cook for one to two minutes more and check for doneness 16. The meat , chicken or seafood should be cooked through and the vegetables should be tender-crisp 17. Remove the curry from the heat and season to taste with the brown sugar and fish sauce 18. Add a stir-in of your choice 19. Transfer to a serving bowl or serve right from the pot 20. Remove the aromatics before serving or tell the guests to eat around them 21. Serve with your choice of garnishes 22. The curry can be eaten as is or served with hot cooked rice

1. After soaking the cod , remove from the water and dry well with a kitchen towel 2. Peel your onions and slice them into half moons also peel the garlic and chop it up 3. Under hot water remove the tomatoes skins and slice them up 4. In a rectangle casserole dish place in 1 / 2 of the olive oil and1 / 2 of the wine 5. Spread the onions , garlic , sliced tomatoes bay leaf , and the potatoes 6. Now place the cod over top of everything and drizzle the remaining wine and olive oil over each fillet 7. Keep basting the cod with the remaining olive oil so as not to dry out on you 8. Bake at 380f for about 1 hour or when potatoes are cooked 9. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley (serve with a green tossed salad , and enjoy

1. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan 2. Add the garlic and lightly brown , but be careful not to burn ! 3. Add the flour , and whisk to combine 4. Mix in the wine and stock 5. Add the clams , cover and cook until the clams open , 6. Add the artichoke hearts , and continue to cook until they are heated through 7. Serve immediately

1. For the avocado cream: place all ingredients into a food processor and give it a whirl until smooth 2. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use 3. Good for one week refrigerated 4. For the salsa: place half of canned tomatoes into food processor 5. Add half of the jalapeno , seeds and all 6. Add the rest of the salsa ingredients 7. Whirl until smooth 8. Taste 9. If youd like more heat , add the rest of the jalapeno pepper and process until smooth 10. Pour into mixing bowl and add the rest of the canned tomatoes 11. Mix and taste 12. Season with more salt if necessary 13. Refrigerate up to two weeks 14. For the rub: mix all rub ingredients together in a small bowl 15. Brush fish fillets with oil 16. Coat both sides of fish generously with the rub 17. Heat a non stick pan over medium-high heat with oil 18. Cook fish in the hot pan , do not crowd , for 4 minutes per side 19. Remove from heat onto a platter , flake with a fork 20. Squeeze fresh lime juice over fish 21. Cover with foil to keep warm 22. Wipe out fish pan and warm tortillas one minute per side in the pan and place into a bowl lined with a clean napkin or kitchen towel to keep warm 23. Layer over warm tortilla 24. Lettuce , tomato , cheese , fish , avocado cream , and salsa

1. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat 2. Saute green onions and bell pepper for 4-5 minutes or until tender 3. Add in crawfish 4. Saute for 1 minute or so until light pink 5. Combine eggs , milk , and cajun seasoning / hot sauce to taste in a bowl 6. Add to skillet 7. Scramble until desired doneness is achieved 8. Add more cajun seasoning if necessary 9. Serve immediately

1. In medium size bowl whisk together 1 tbsp olive oil , rosemary , oregano , pepper , salt 2. Rinse and pat dry lamb chops , place in bowl , turning to coat with seasoning mix 3. Let marinate at least 15 min and up until 6 hrs in fridge 4. Place chops in a casserole dish and bake in oven for 30 min at 350 degrees 5. You may need to check and add a small bit of water to pan so chops do not stick or burn on bottom 6. Check to see if all pink is cleared , place sliced tomatoe and sliced mozzerella on top of chop in order stated , use additional pepper to taste and bake for 5 more minutes 7. Remove from oven and let sit for 5 minutes so juices can set and meld into meat 8. Serve with a crusty loaf of bread and your favorite sides 9. You may also choose to add red pepper flakes for heat i used 1 / 2 tsp on 2 chops , sprinkled after in oven 10. Thickness of chop will effect cooking time as well so if thin check after 20 minutes 11. Ovens vary so please check to be sure at the 30 min time frame

1. Brown lamb shanks all over in a fry pan , remove and set to one side 2. In a large saucepan , heat some oil , add onion and celery , cook until onion softens 3. Add wine , stock , garlic bulb , rosemary , thyme , bay leaf and vinegar 4. Return lamb and bring to the boil , reduce heat to a simmer and cook covered over a very low heat , for 2-21 / 2 hours or until lamb is falling off the bone 5. Remove lamb and keep warm , remove garlic bulb , strain the liquid through a sieve , return liquid to pan 6. Squeeze garlic from bulb either blend or process sauce until smooth 7. Mix a little water with the cornflour and add to sauce , bring to the boil and stir until mixture thickens 8. Caramelized vegetables 9. You will notice if you read the intro above i usually make this with parsnips , turnips and carrots but i could get a hold of these so i made it with carrot and sweet poatoes instead 10. Combine all the ingredients , except thyme , in a roasting pan , coat vegetables well , place thyme sprigs on top , and roast 30-40 min's , covered , in a pre-heated oven 180 degrees celcius or until vegetables are cooked through 11. Serve over mash with caramelized vegetables

1. Peel the tomatoes , remove the calyx and cut into quarters 2. If you prefer , you can drop the tomatoes into boiling water for one minute and then refresh in ice cold water- this makes removing the skins easier 3. Toss the shanks in the flour -i do this in a large plastic bag for a no mess cleanup 4. Shake off any excess flour 5. Discard excess flour 6. Heat half of the oil in the cooker and brown the shanks , two at a time if necessary 7. Remove and set aside 8. Add the remaining oil and the onion , carrots and garlic 9. Fry for 5 minutes , stirring occassionally 10. Add the tomatoes , oregano , lemon rind , wine and stock 11. Bring to the boil , stirring well , for a few minutes 12. Return the lamb shanks to the cooker and season well with salt and pepper 13. Spoon some of the sauce and vegetables over the meat 14. Close and lock the lid 15. Set cooker to high pressure and cook for 25 minutes 16. Carefully release pressure from the cooker and check the meat is cooked 17. The meat should be very tender and almost falling off the bone 18. Cook a furtehr 5 minutes if required 19. If you would like the gravy a little thicker- add the remaining flour to the cold water and stir until smooth 20. Simmer gravy and add the flour paste in slowly until the gravy is thicker 21. Serve with mashed potato and a green veg -- or baked tiny tomatoes as we did 22. The green or red really adds colour to the plated meal

1. Mix all the marinade ingredients together in a bowl 2. Pierce the lamb all over with a small sharp knife 3. Place the lamb on a large plate or container 4. Pour the marinade over the lamb and massage it into the meat , coating it well 5. Cover the lamb and leave it to marinate for 12-48 hours 6. Heat a barbecue to moderate-high and place the lamb on the rack , coating it well with the marinade 7. If possible place the lid over the lamb and leave it to cook slowly for 1 1 / 2 hours , coating it with the marinade and turning it each 30 minutes 8. Remove the lamb from the direct heat and allow it to rest in a warm place for 10-15 minutes before slicing

1. Place rice in a bowl with cold water and leave to soak for 20 minutes 2. Meanwhile , heat the oil and butter in a large heavy saucepan , add the chopped onion and minced meat and fry until golden brown and breaking down any lumps in the mince 3. Add the broken vermicelli and fry for another 5-10 minutes till slightly brown 4. Drain and wash the rice till water runs clean 5. Add the rice into the pan and give it a good stir 6. Add in all the spices and mix it in well 7. Add in the boiling-hot stock and give it all one good stir 8. Cover the pan and simmer over low heat for about 15-20 minutes 9. Take the pan off the heat , take the lid off and cover the pan with a clean towel and leave to rest for 10 minutes 10. Gently fluff up the rice with a fork and serve with pine seeds sprinkled on top

1. Cut up chicken and add cumin , taco seasoning salt + pepper , paprika , and adobo , set to the side 2. Cook rice according to the directions on the box 3. In a large saute or frying pan on med-high heat , estimate and add 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil 4. Add chicken 5. While chicken is cooking , peel avacados and make guacamole according to package directions 6. Refrigerate 7. Open cans of black beans , corn , diced tomatoes with chiles and cilantro and put in small bowls 8. If you'd like , you can warm , the can of beans and corn 9. Don't warm the can of diced tomatoes , unless you like warm salsa / tomato mixture 10. Once chicken and rice is done , you can start plating 11. Letting everyone add the toppings of their choice is part of the fun of the meal ! 12. P 13. S 14. Suggestion for plating - put shredded lettuce in bowl or plate first - then add rice , then chicken , then toppings

1. Mix sour cream and taco seasoning 2. Chill for 30 minutes 3. Combine beans and salsa in sauce pan and heat on medium until evenly blended 4. Let cool 5. Spread beans and salsa in 11x13 inch pan 6.
