Spread sour cream / taco seasoning mixture over beans 7. Layer cheese , olives , lettuce , tomatoes , avocados and green onions over each ingredient 8. Serve with tortilla chips

1. Fry bacon , drain and crumble 2. Sit aside 3. Mix ingredients for topping 4. Layer all ingredients in order given , in a very large glass bowl , starting with lettuce 5. Cut up lettuce or tear up 6. Wash and tear spinach 7. Chop green onions 8. Pour in thawed frozen peas 9. Pour in sliced , cubed mushrooms 10. Place bacon on very top 11. Pour topping over all 12. Refrigerate overnight 13. Do not mix till ready to serve

1. Peel tomato and cut off top 2. Scoop out pulp 3. Peel and dice the avocados , add lemon juice and coat well add onion , chili , cumin tabasco , and salt 4. Stuff tomato with avocado mixture , chill for at least 1 / 2 hour and serve over lettuce

1. Whisk together olive oil , vinegar , mustard , garlic , pepper , and salt until well blended 2. Fold in cheese 3. Break the leaves off of both heads of lettuce , tear them by hand 4. Wash and drain 5. In a large wooden bowl , toss lettuce with shredded carrots and cabbage 6. Garnish with croutons and top with dressing to taste

1. Preheat oven to 325f 2. In large pot filled with water add 3 pinches of salt and the macaroni and place over high heat 3. Bring to a boil and let cook until al dente , about 8 minutes 4. Drain 5. Set aside 6. In a large saucepan , melt butter 7. Sprinkle flour over butter and cook 2 to 3 minutes on medium heat , whisking until a roux or paste forms 8. Add cold milk and whisk vigorously until dissolved 9. Cook sauce on medium-low heat until thick and bubbly 10. Add heavy cream , all cheeses , 1 tablespoon salt , and 1 tablespoon pepper 11. Cook until cheeses are fully melted , stirring occasionally 12. Add cooked macaroni to cheese mixture and mix thoroughly 13. Place macaroni mixture in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish and top with bread crumbs 14. Place in the oven and bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown 15. Top with fresh parsley and serve 16. For variations , add cooked lobster meat , truffle oil , bacon and / or garden fresh vegetables

1. Brown beef and onion in oil 2. Cook until onion is tender 3. In a bowl , combine spaghetti sauce , garlic and onion powders 4. Mix well and combine with the macaroni and the beef and onion mixture 5. In a 2-quart casserole , layer the meat / macaroni mixture with the shredded cheese and pepperoni 6. Ending with the cheese 7. Bake , uncovered , in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f 2. Lightly grease 8 small cast iron skillets , or a 9" x 13" casserole dish 3. Cook the macaroni according to package directions , but add 1 tablespoon salt to the water and cook for only 5 minutes 4. Drain and add to a large bowl 5. Heat a large skillet on medium-high and brown the pork , stirring to crumble as it cooks , about 4 minutes 6. Add the onion and cook for another 4 minutes , then add the hidden valley original ranch seasoning mix , spinach , vinegar , garlic , tomatoes , chives , rosemary , oregano , cayenne , cinnamon and olives 7. Cook for another 5 minutes and mix into the macaroni 8. Wipe out the skillet and heat the oil and butter on medium and whisk in the flour , cooking for a minute 9. Whisk in the milk and stock and cook until it thickens 10. Turn the heat to low and stir in the parmesan cheese , yogurt , cream cheese and 1 cup shredded cheese 11. As soon as the cheeses are melted and blended , add to the macaroni 12. Divide between 8 personal skillets , about 1 cup of mixture for each 13. Top each skillet with 1 / 8 cup shredded cheese and scatter each with feta crumbles 14. Bake for 20-25 minutes , or until cheese is melted and bubbly 15. Makes 8 servings in 6 1 / 2 inch cast iron skillets or a 9"x13" casserole

1. Bring 4 quarts water to boil in large pot 2. Add 1 tablespoon salt and macaroni and cook until nearly tender , about 5 minutes 3. Drain in colander and rinse with cold water until cool , then drain once more , briefly , so that pasta is still moist 4. Transfer to large bowl 5. Stir in bell peppers , celery , scallions , vinegar , hot sauce , chili powder , garlic powder , and cayenne pepper , and let sit until flavors are absorbed , about 2 minutes 6. Stir in mayonnaise and barbecue sauce and let sit until salad is no longer watery , about 5 minutes 7. Stir in cheddar cheese 8. Season with salt and pepper and serve

1. Cook macaroni in boiling salted water until tender 2. Drain macaroni 3. Combine tomato paste , water and baking soda and set aside 4. Fry bacon in a medium fry pan until medium done 5. Add mushrooms , green pepper , onions , and cook until tender 6. Add ground beef , stirring constantly until beef is done 7. Add all seasonings and half of tomato paste mixture and simmer for 5 minutes for flavors to blend 8. Place half of the cooked macaroni in a greased 9x 13 casserole dish 9. Sprinkle half the parmesan cheese 10. Cover with all the meat mixture 11. Cover with remaining half of cooked macaroni 12. Sprinkle with remainging parmesan cheese 13. Finally , top with remaining tomato paste mixture 14. If desired , top with bread crumb mixture 15. Cover casserole tightly and bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes

1. Preheat oven to 350f 2. Boil pasta according to directions- making sure to not overcook ! 3. If meatballs are frozen , thaw--i like to brown mine either on the stove or in the oven 4. Combine the ricotta , sour cream and italian seasoning- i add an extra dash of garlic and freshly ground pepper 5. Spray a 9x13 deep baker with pam 6. Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of baking pan 7. Top this with 1 / 2 of the pasta shells drained 8. Top with the ricotta mixture 9. Top with all the meatballs 10. Then layer with remaining 1 / 2 of shell pasta 11. Top with all the sauce 12. Top with the mozzarella and parmesan cheese 13. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes until heated through and cheese is bubbly !

1. In a large pot , add the meatballs , green beans , carrots , beef broth , worcestershire sauce , allspice , and cinnamon 2. Stir to combine 3. Bring mixture to a boil 4. Lower heat , cover , and simmer for 10 minutes 5. Add in the undrained tomatoes 6. Stir to combine 7. Return mixture to boiling 8. Lower heat and simmer , covered for 5-10 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender 9. Season with salt and pepper to taste , if desired 10. To freeze: place in a rigid container 11. To reheat: thaw and heat through

1. Meatballs -- combine the pork , mushrooms , scallions , garlic , rice cooking wine , hoisin sauce , salt & pepper 2. Mix everything together and then form meatballs 3. I make mine about golf ball size 4. This just helps when i go to saute them 5. It is optional , but does help 6. Noodles -- as the meatballs cool off , make the oriental noodles 7. Now if your grocer doesn't have oriental noodles in the asian or oriental section , use spaghetti 8. Cook accordingly to the directions 9. Drain and add to a serving bowl 10. Mix the soy sauce , scallions , garlic , red pepper flakes , sesame oil and vegetable and pour over the noodles and toss 11. Cover and refrigerate 12. Sometimes before serving , i like to garnish with just a little sesame oil and peanuts if you want , but sometimes i don't 13. I like the simple flavors 14. But go easy , the sesame oil is very strong 15. Dipping sauce -- meatballs are almost ready , but make a quick 1 minute dipping sauce for them 16. Mix the soy , hoisin and lime 17. That is it 18. Just set it in a bowl to the side 19. Now -- dipping sauce is done -- sesame noodles are done and chilling , meatballs are chilled and ready to cook 20. As they cook we will put a 5 minute salad together and dinner is served 21. Meatballs -- in non stick pan heat up the oil to medium high and add the meatballs 22. Just a few seconds on each side to get a little golden , but remember , we aren't trying to cook them , just a light sear is all 23. Not too long , maybe 2 minutes total is all you need 24. Then add the chicken broth and cover and let them simmer and steam on medium low to low 25. Should take about 10 minutes 26. Don't over crowd the pan by stacking the meatballs , but a big enough pan should work just fine 27. Don't peak either 28. Salad -- now the easy part 29. As the meatballs steam 30. Do a quick salad on the side 31. Slice up some napa cabbage and add to a serving bowl , add a can of sliced water chestnuts , a can of mandarine oranges and thin slice a small red onion , and about 1 / 2 of a seedless cucumber , skin on is fine 32. Just toss and then serve with a quality sesame dressing 33. I don't like many bottled dressing but there are a few out there that are really pretty good 34. Make it easy on yourself 35. You can always add mushrooms , red peppers , or any other vegetables you like but i like it really simple for this salad 36. Now 3 courses and just 30-40 minutes

1. Spray a 9-inch by 13-inch baking pan with non-stick cooking spray 2. Place cooked ravioli in baking dish 3. Top with meatballs 4. Pour pasta sauce evenly over it all 5. Sprinkle on italian seasoning and shredded cheese 6. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted

1. Place ketchup , jelly , hot sauce , garlic powder and onion flakes in a small saucepan , and stir over medium heat until jelly melts and everything is well mixed 2. Place meatballs in a crock pot or large sauce pan and cover with sauce , stirring to mix everything up 3. Heat on low setting for 20 minutes on the stove or several hours in the crock pot , until meatballs are hot and sauce sticks to them well 4. Serve hot

1. Preheat oven to 150c / 300f put 6 paper muffin cups into 6 small oven-proof dishes 2. Mix condensed milk , joghurt and cardamom with a whisk in a bowl 3. Fold in pistachios and roughly chopped raisins 4. Divide mixture into paper muffin cups 5. Set oven-proof dishes into a roasting tin filled with warm water up to the middle of the oven proof-dishes 6. Figs in syrup: 7. In the meantime heat 300ml water together with the sugar , the spices , the grated lemon rind and the lemon juice over low heat 8. When the sugar is dissolved , increase the temperature , so that the mixture simmers 9. Let simmer for 5 minutes 10. Divide each fig into four or six parts lengthwise and add them to the syrup 11. Simmer for 2 minutes and then remove pan from the heat immediately 12. Leave the figs to cool in the syrup 13. When the joghurt mixture in the oven is cooked through , remove individual dishes from water and let cool 14. To serve , turn out the baked yoghurt on individual plates and remove the paper cup 15. Place the fig parts on top or around the baked joghurt and pour a little bit of the syrup around the joghurt 16. Sprinkle with chopped pistachios

1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees 2. With an electric mixer or wire whisk , beat eggs until frothy 3. Whisk in flour 4. Stir in milk and salt 5. Melt butter in a 10-inch oven-proof skillet 6. Pour mixture into hot skillet and place in preheated oven 7. Bake 15 minutes or until pancake is puffed and golden 8. The center will be shaped like a bowl 9. Remove from oven 10. Fill with fruit , dust with powdered sugar and sprinkle with almonds 11. Serve immediately

1. Blend the pancake batter in blender 3 minutes 2. Pour into bowl and let rise until double 3. In non-stick pan pour batter that is consistency of crepe batter into lightly oiled pan 4. Oil the pan every time you make one 5. Swirl like crepe batter 6. Cook until dry on top 7. Don't flip over 8. Will resemble honeycombs 9. Stack on towel 10. Not on each other 11. Will stick when warm 12. Warm syrup ingredients together 13. Pour over honeycomb side

1. Mix 2 cups flour , undissolved yeast , sugar and salt in a large mixer bowl 2. Heat milk , butter and honey until very warm 3. Add to flour mixture with rum , egg yolks and egg 4. Beat 1 minute at low speed 5. Increase speed to medium and beat 2 minutes 6. Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough 7. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic , about 3 to 4 minutes 8. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes 9. Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1 / 2-inch thickness 10. Use a 3-inch cookie or biscuit cutter , to cut out as many rounds as possible 11. Place rounds about 2 to 3 inches apart on parchment lined or lightly greased baking sheets 12. Re-roll and cut remaining dough 13. Cover and let rise in a warm , draft free place 45 minutes to 1 hour , until doubled in size 14. Preheat oven to 375f 15. For glaze , mix honey and melted butter 16. Set aside 17. Bake 10 minutes 18. Brush glaze over packzi and continue baking for 2 to 4 minutes until light golden brown 19. If desired , brush again with any remaining glaze 20. Let cool slightly , then dust or roll in sugar or powdered sugar 21. Fillings: 22. Fruit or custard: use a knife to cut a small slit in side of paczki 23. Use a small spoon to insert a heaping teaspoonful 24. Chocolate: use your finger to gently poke a small hole in side of paczki and insert 1 teaspoon chocolate chips into center of paczki while still warm

1. Oven temp 160 c- 325 f 2. Heat oil , add the cumin 3. When it splutters , add the onions and stir-fry over high heat , till well covered with oil 4. Add the corn and palak and continue to stir-fry over high heat , to mix well 5. Add the flour , stir fry till slightly colored and add the milk , stirring continuously , till well blended 6. Add salt and black pepper and transfer on to an oven-proof serving dish 7. Sprinkle the cheese on top 8. Bake in a pre-heated oven for half an hour before serving 9. You can omit spinach and increase corn

1. In large non-stick skillet , saut mushrooms and garlic in margarine until tender 2. Add 1 1 / 4 cup broth , rosemary , and thyme 3. Bring to boil 4. Cook until reduced by two-thirds 5. Add 2 / 3 cup broth , sherry or additional broth , teriyaki , and hot pepper sauce 6. Cook and stir over high heat until mixture is reduced by two-thirds 7. Add remaining broth , reduce heat , and simmer 5 minutes 8. In bowl , combine milk powder and cornstarch 9. Gradually stir in milk until well blended 10. Stir milk mixture into sauce 11. Bring to boil 12. Cook and stir for 2 minutes , or until thickened 13. Reduce heat , add cheese , mustard , and oregano 14. Stir until cheese is melted 15. For vegetarian use the vegetable broth

1. Melt the butter in your soup pot over medium heat 2. Add all the vegetables and saute until the onions are opaque and the celery and leek have softened - approximately 5 - 10 minutes 3. Add flour and mix well 4. Add milk and chicken stock and mix well 5. Season with slat and pepper 6. Reduce heat to medium low - cover and cook for 25 minutes stirring occasionally 7. Use a hand blender or a regular blender to puree the soup 8. Serve

1. Preheat oven to 375f 2. Lightly press hash brown potatoes into greased 9-inch pie plate to form crust 3. Sprinkle with 1 / 2 cup of the cheese 4. Top with mushrooms and broccoli 5. Beat eggs , milk , thyme , onion powder and pepper with wire whisk until well blended 6. Pour over broccoli 7. Sprinkle with remaining 1 / 2 cup cheese 8. Bake 35 minute or until center is set and top is golden brown 9. Creative leftovers: 10. This is great reheated the next day 11. Microwave each slice on high 1 to 2 minute or until heated through 12. Serve for lunch with a side salad

1. Preheat oven 350f 2. Layer potatoes , carrots , onions , mushrooms , celery , tomatoes and ground beef in a baking dish 3. Pour juice and water over mixture 4. Salt & pepper to taste 5. Sprinkle crackers or panko bread crumbs over top 6. Bake covered in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 2 hours 7. Uncover the last half hour to brown

1. Preheat an oven to 400f 2. In a large saucepan over medium heat , melt the butter 3. Add the flour and cook , stirring constantly , until the mixture smells fragrant and nutty , 1 to 2 minutes 4. Slowly add the broth , whisking until smooth , and bring to a boil 5. Add the thyme , bay leaf , shallot , celery , carrots , mushroom , peas , potatoes , and chicken 6. Sea salt and pepper 7. Simmer , covered until the potatoes are tender , 10-15 minutes 8. Thicken with cornstarch if necessary 9. Remove bay leaf and discard 10. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes 11. Add heavy cream 12. Divide the filling among 4 ovenproof ramekins and place on a baking sheet 13. Brush the puff pastry squares with the egg mixture 14. Brush the rims of the bowls with water 15. Place 1 pastry square on top of each bowl , pressing lightly on the edges 16. Bake until the pastry is puffed and golden brown , about 15-20 minutes 17. Remove from oven 18. Let rest for 5-10 minutes before serving 19. Serves 4

1. Cook pasta until desired doneness 2. Drain , rinse with cool water to cool and drain again 3. Meanwhile in small bowl , mix vinegar , sugar 3 t oil and seasoning packet from soup mix 4. Pour vinegar mix over salad and toss gently to coat 10. Cover and refrigerate until serving 11. Just before serving , break ramen noodles into pieces 12. Add noodles and sesame seeds and toss 13. Sprinkle parmesan on top

1. Bown beef and mushrooms and 1 / 2 chopped onions 2. Add tomato sause salt , pepper , and garlic salt and simmer for 1 / 2 hour 3. Cook noodles 4. Combine cottage cheese , sour cream , remaining chopped onions and green peppers 5. Buttered casserole 6. Layer meat , noodles and cheese mixture , ending with meat on top 7. Bake at 300 degrees for 45 minutes 8. First 1 / 2 of cooking time with lid on casserole , remaining with lid off

1. In a dutch oven or soup kettle , combine the water , chicken , onion , celery , carrots and bouillon 2. Bring to a boil 3. Reduce heat 4. Simmer , uncovered , for 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and vegetables are tender 5. Stir in the corn , noodles and butter 6. Cook 10 minutes longer or until noodles are tender 7. Season with salt and pepper

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees 2. Grease a 9 x 13 pan 3. Mix all ingredients together in a very large bowl 4. Spread into pan 5. Sprinkle top with cinnamon and bake 1 hour to 1 hour and 20 minutes , or until golden brown 6. Let cool before cutting into squares 7. Can be served cold or at room temperature

1. Bring water to boil 2. Add half of seasoning packet 3. Boil noodles for only two minutes 4. Drain and set aside to cool 5. Meanwhile for dressing , combine mayo , sambal olek , and lemon juice 6. In a medium to large sized bowl toss cabbage , carrots , scallions , snow peas 7. Add cooled noodles 8. Toss with dressing 9. To serve , top with peanuts and cilantro 10. Season to taste

1. Cook pasta and set aside 2. Place onions , dill pickles , olives , water chestnuts , chives and peppers in a bowl 3. Add oil , vinegar and spices 4. Marinate for 15-20 minutes or so 5. Add pasta , tomatoes , meat and cheese and toss lightly 6. Serve cold

1. Preheat oven to 400 2. Combine the sauce and water in a mixing bowl 3. Stir in the ricotta , parmesan , and 1 / 2 the mozzarella , then the uncooked ziti 4. Spoon the mixture into a 9x13 baking dish and cover with foil 5. Bake for 55 minutes 6. Remove the foil , sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella , and bake for an additional 5 minutes

1. Heat a large pot of water over a medium heat until water boils 2. Place vegetables in steamer and steam until cooked al dente 3. While vegetables are steaming , cook pasta as per instructions from manufacturer 4. Place a large saute pan over a medium heat 5. Once pan is hot add olive oil and garlic 6. Gently saute garlic 7. A 8. Dd a good quality chicken stock to the pan and bring to the boil 9. Strain pasta and vegetables and add to saute pan 10. Add fresh basil , lemon zest , parmesan cheese , sun-dried tomatoes and parsley 11. Toss pasta thoroughly

1. Combine sugar flour and salt in a saucepan 2. Gradually stir in 1 3 / 4 cup of pineapple juice and eggs and cook until thick 3. Add lemon juice and stir well 4. In a separate pan boil 3 quarts of water , 1 teaspoon of oil and the dry pasta 5. Cook until soft 6. Drain and rinse with cold water 7. Let cool to room temperature 8. Combine with egg mixture and refrigerate overnight in an air tight container 9. Mix lightly and add the mandarin oranges , pineapple , marshmallows and coconut 10. Serve immediately

1. In 4-quart dutch oven , cook and drain pasta as directed on package , adding peas and carrots during last 5 minutes of cooking 2. Drain , return to dutch oven 3. Meanwhile , in 10-inch nonstick skillet , heat oil over medium heat 4. Add chicken , cook 9 to 11 minutes , stirring frequently , until chicken is no longer pink in center 5. Stir chicken , alfredo sauce and basil into pasta mixture in dutch oven 6. Cook and stir over medium heat until thoroughly heated

1. Preheat oven to 450 2. In large skillet brown pepperoni and bacon in oil 3. Drain and set aside 4. Saute mushrooms , green peppers and onions until soft 5. Add all other ingredients except cheese and stir well , simmering for 15 minutes 6. Divide sauce between 2 pizzas and cover with cheese 7. Bake for 20-25 minutes , or until crust is golden brown

1. To a food processor , add the sliced pepperoni 2. Mix until most of the pepperoni is ground up , pulsing as you go 3. Add the ground beef and sausage 4. Form meat into 4 patties 5. To a large skillet over medium / med-high heat , melt the butter and olive oil until butter is melted 6. If using mushrooms , saute them until done , 1-2 minutes 7. Remove with slotted spoon and set aside 8. Add the patties to the pan and cook 4-5 minutes per side until cooked thru 9. Pat the burgers down with the spatula as needed to retain a wide burger 10. When burgers are just about done , place mushrooms on burgers , then 1 slice each of the cheeses on top of each burger 11. Reduce heat to low , cover tightly and let steam until cheese is melted 12. Place burgers on top of bottom bun then spread warmed pizza sauce over top of melted cheese 13. Close up buns and enjoy

1. Preheat your oven to recommended pizza crust cooking temperature 2. Shred your cheese 3. Start cooking your bacon 4. Now we start on the pizza sauce 5. Grab your butter and start melting it in a large non stick pan on medium / low heat 6. As soon as the butter is nice and melted slowly ! add and whisk in the flour a little bit at a time 7. It should never clump up and be lumpy 8. It should always be smooth and bubbly 9. Once all the flour is in the mix add your milk and spices 10. Once the sauce is back up to boiling go ahead and add your cream cheese 11. Let the cream cheese just melt into the sauce while slowly stirring it 12. Once its blended set it on a back burner on low heat 13. Now we make the eggs 14. Crack all of your eggs into a bowl and add in your spices 15. Whisk furiously ! until they are nice and airy 16. Melt a 1 / 2 tbsp of butter to the bottom of a nonstick pan and add your eggs 17. I have a pattern to my eggs follow it if you wish 18. I do not stir eggs 19. I scrape the pan in an orderly fashion starting from the center out in both directions 20. Once the eggs are still a little runny i pile them in the middle of the pan and turn the heat off 21. They finish on their own 22. Now that all of the main ingredients are done all that's left is putting them on your crust 23. Take the pizza crust out and put it on a baking sheet 24. Now put as much sauce as you prefer on your dough 25. Next add your cheese 26. Add roughly 3 / 4 of the cheese on now 27. Sprinkled evenly from edge to edge 28. Next take your bacon and crumble it up and spread it evenly over the pizza 29. Now sprinkle on your turkey sausage crumbles 30. Now add your eggs 31. And the last of the cheese ! 32. Now take that remaining 1 / 2 tbsp of garlic powder and mix it with the 4 tbsp of olive oil 33. Add this to the "crust" of the pizza 34. Now pop it in the oven !

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees 2. Pat chopped and drained artichokes dry with papertowels 3. In large bowl , combine artichokes , pepper , salt and garlic 4. Add spinach , chicken & shredded provolone- gently toss 5. Line your largest cookie sheet with foil 6. Pour olive oil over foil and brush or spread with back of spoon evenly over foil 7. Sprinkle cornmeal over oil 8. Unroll pizza dough onto prepared cookie sheet , use a roller pizza cutter and cut the dough into 6 even sections 9. Cover and let sit 5 minutes 10. Pat each section into 5 by 6 inch sheets 11. Spoon mixture onto half of rectangle sheet making sure not to cross the diagonal 12. Fold across the diagonal to make triangle calzones and squeeze edges of dough to create a seal 13. Bake on center rack for 12 minutes or until golden

1. Preheat oven to 400 2. Roll the dough to 12x12-inch square and then cut into 4 equal squares 3. In a medium bowl , mix all remaining ingredients except egg and water 4. Place filling a little off center on each dough square 5. Wrap dough around filling by bringing one side over to meet other , forming a triangle 6. Round off corners to form a semi-circle and press edges with fork , sealing 7. Place on baking sheet and brush top of each calzone with egg wash 8. Bake until golden brown , about 25 minutes 9. Remove from oven and let set about 7 minutes 10. Serve hot !

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f 2. Melt butter in medium skillet and add onion and green pepper , and saute over medium-high heat until tender , about 5 minutes 3. Place bread cubes in medium bowl , add onion and green peppers , and remaining stuffing ingredients and mix well 4. The stuffing should be fairly moist 5. Add more broth if needed or if using hard bread cubes 6. In same skillet , heat olive oil over medium-high heat and quickly brown chops , about one minute each side 7. About 10 minutes before chops are done , using the same skillet , melt butter over medium heat 11. Add sliced mushrooms and saute for about 2 minutes , until they begin to soften 12. Add wine and cook until its almost all evaporated 13. Stir in flour well 14. Dont worry , it will be dry 15. Stir in chicken broth and let it quickly come to a boil 16. Immediately reduce heat and let simmer for a few minutes to thicken 17. If too thick for your liking , just stir in more broth and continue to simmer 18. Spoon a little sauce over each chop and serve hot !

1. Combine eggs , milk , and worcestershire 2. Stir in crumbs , cheese , parsley , pepper , salt , sage , onions and garlic 3. Add beef and pork and mix well using wet hands 4. Place mixture in a loaf pan 5. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 1 1 / 4 hours 6. Drain off any excess fat 7. Mix together catsup , brown sugar , and mustard 8. Spread over meat 9. Return to oven for 10 minutes

1. Cut pork loin through the center length ways being careful not cut all the way through 2. Open out using a meat mallet pound pork until of equal thickness 3. Stuffing -- 4. Spoon stuffing over one half of the pork and press mixture down , fold the other half over the top , secure with kitchen at regular intervals , place in an oven proof dish 6. To serve: slice pork thickly and serve over stir-fried veg , drizzle with sauce

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees 2. Remove all visible fat from pork 3. Place in a shallow baking pan 4. In a small bowl , whisk together remaining ingredients except sesame seeds and onions 5. Brush honey mixture over pork 6. Sprinkle with sesame seeds 7. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes 8. To serve , slice thinly and garnish with green onions

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees 2. In mixing bowl , combine both packages of cream cheese , butter and flour 3. Beat until soft dough forms 4. Wrap in wax paper and chill 1 hour 5. In a large skillet , brown ground meats , then drain 6. Return meat to skillet and add onion and saute 7. Add garlic , cumin , seasoned salt and jalapeno 8. Place a spoonful of the meat mixture on each dough round 12. With finger dipped in beaten egg , spread egg around edges of dough , fold over and press edges with a fork 13. Place empanadas on a greased baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown

1. Preheat oven 350f 2. Layer potatoes , carrots , onions , mushrooms , celery , tomatoes and ground beef in a baking dish 3. Pour juice and water over mixture 4. Salt & pepper to taste 5. 1. Cut and cook pumpkin 2. Preheat oven to 425f 3. Use a blender , if you don't it will be stringy 4. Pour in and cook 425f for 10 minutes than lower temperature to 350f and cook for 60 minutes

Add sweet potato , salt , chicken broth and pumpkin and bring to a boil 4. Refrigerate overnight

Cinnamon-chocolate cream cheese frosting 22. Place the cream cheese and the butter in a large mixing bowl 23. Blend with an electric mixer on low speed until well combined , 30 seconds 24. Add the cocoa powder , cinnamon , vanilla , and 3 3 / 4 cups of the confectioners' sugar 25. Blend with the mixer on low speed until the ingredients are moistened , 30 seconds 26. Add more sugar if the frosting seems too thin 27. Increase the speed to medium and beat until the frosting is fluffy , 2 minutes more

1. Combine the first 8 ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting lid or cruet that holds at least 8 oz 2. Shake until sugar is dissolved 3. Optional: sprinkle almonds on just before serving to help keep them crisp

Drain and set aside to cool 5. When artichokes are cool enough to handle pull off the leaves and cut out the fuzzy chokes 6. Slice the hearts into bite size wedges and squeeze the other half of lemon over the hearts , set aside 7. Peel and section the oranges discarding the seeds and white pith in a large bowl 8. When ready to serve , alternate orange sections and artichoke wedges on individual plates 9. Garnish with radish slices , olives and a mixture of the olive oil and lemon juice that will be drizzled over the salad 10. Sprinkle with paprika and salt , serve immediately

1. Put the tomatoes , cucumbers and red radish on a plate 2. Place the spring onions in the center 3. Place onion slices on the tomatoes 4. Season with salt , pepper , and dill 5. Serve with sour cream

1. Grate the cheese , or cut into thin matchstick slices 2. Slice the radishes in half 3. In a bowl , combine cheese , radishes , shallot , and chives 4. In a small bowl , whisk together the remaining ingredients to form a dressing 5. Pour over th cheese mixture , and let sit for 30 minutes before serving

1. Boil the water and then pour over the bulgur wheat 2. Cover and allow to sit for about 1 hour 3. Add lime juice and olive oil , then refrigerate 4. Once chilled add the veggies and cumin 5. Stir gently and serve chilled 6. All vegetable amounts are appoximate 7. Use however much you prefer

1. Saute chicken , garlic , a little salt and pepper , red peppers and onion in butter til chicken is done 2. Stir in mushrooms and olives 3. In lightly greased 13x9 pan layer: 4. 1 / 2 cheese raviolis 5. 1 / 2 chicken mixture 6. 1 / 2 of the ricotta or cottage cheese 7. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese 8. 1 / 2 of the alfredo sauce 9. 1 / 2 of the shredded cheese 10. Repeat 11. Bake in 350 oven , covered , for 30 minutes 12. Uncover and bake 5-10 minutes longer

1. Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and heat broiler 2. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over med-high heat 3. Add ravioli and cook , stirring occasionally , until golden brown , 3-5 minutes 4. Stir in broth and cream and cook , covered until ravioli are nearly tender , about 3 minutes 5. Remove lid and continue to cook until sauce is slightly thickened and ravioli are completely tender , about 3 minutes 6. Off heat , stir in pesto and 1 / 4 cup cheese into pan with ravioli 7. Transfer to broiler safe 1 1 / 2 quart casserole dish 8. Arrange tomatoes over ravioli and season with salt and pepper to taste 9. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and broil until surface is spotty brown , about 3 minutes 10. Serve

1. Preheat oven to 425f 2. Heat oil in saucepan over medium high heat 3. Add onion and garlic , season with salt and pepper and cook until onions are softened 4. Add thyme and tomatoes and bring to a boil 5. Reduce heat and simmer , breaking up the tomatoes 6. Reduce sauce until it is about 5 cups 7. Cook ravioli in a pot of boiling water just until they float 8. Drain 9. Toss sauce and ravioli together in a casserole dish 10. Top with cheeses 11. Bake 20-25 minutes

1. In a sauce pan on low heat combine heavy whipping cream , white wine , butter , flour , oregano , parsley , 1 clove of garlic , cheese and some pepper 2. Whisk sauce gently while ingredients blend , then raise heat to medium 3. Sauce will come to a boil , keep whisking every 4-6 minutes to prevent clumping 4. Once sauce has thickened , return heat to low , and let simmer 5. While sauce is cooking , take olive oil , 1 clove of garlic , and zucchini 6. Cook in a saut pan on medium heat 7. You can add pepper and a 2 teaspoons of white wine to taste if you like 8. Let zucchini cook on medium heat for 8-10 minutes , then drain in a strainer 9. Prepare your pasta of choice as indicated on bag , and drain 10. In a serving bowl , combine pasta , white wine sauce , and zucchini 11. Sprinkle a some pecorino romano cheese on top and serve

1. Heat vegetable oil in a wide deep skillet or dutch oven 2. Add onion , and cook over medium-high heat for 5 mins until onion is translucent 3. Add ground beef and , using a large spoon or fork to break up , cook until the meat is browned 4. Add next 5 ingredients , rinsing out each can with a few tablespoons of water and adding the water to the pot 5. Cook for 15-20 minutes to let the flavors blend 6. Salt to taste 7. As the chili simmers , bring a large pot of water to boil and salt the water 8. When the water boils , add the frozen ravioli , and when the water returns to a boil , lower heat to simmer 9. Cook 4 or 5 mins until ravioli is cooked through 10. Place in serving bowls with chili over the top , sprinkled with grated cheese

1. To make the sofrito: heat the oil and butter in a saucepan , add the tomatoes , scallions , onion , garlic , ground cumin , achiote and cook gently for 10 minutes , stirring until softened 2. Reduce the heat to low , add the salt , pepper and cilantro , cook for 10 minutes more , stirring occasionally until the sauce has thickened 3. Check and adjust the seasoning 4. Set aside 5. To make the rice: in a large pan over medium heat , add the pork belly 6. Saut for 5 minutes or until the pork belly is brown 7. Add the pork ribs 8. Cook for 5 minutes more 9. Stirring often 10. Add the chicken pieces and saut for 4 minutes on each side or until brown 11. Add the rice and stir to coat 12. Add the chicken stock , stir and cook for about 15 minutes 13. Add the peas , carrots , salt , pepper and cumin , cook for about 10 more minutes 14. Reduce the heat to low , add the hogao , milk and cheese and cook for 10 minutes more 15. Remove from the heat and let it sit for 5 minutes 16. Add the fresh cilantro and serve warm

1. Mix rub ingredients and store in air tight container 2. Recommend making a triple batch so you'll have some for later 3. Remove membrane from bone side of ribs 4. Rub ribs generously with rub , wrap in plastic wrap , and refrigerate over night 5. Remove wrap from ribs and bring to room temperature 6. Re-season with rub 7. For the finishing sauce , combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil , reduce heat and simmer for one hour 11. For the smoke , use apple wood chips soaked in water 12. Keep the temperature as close to 200 as possible 13. Apply finishing sauce during the last hour--careful not to burn 14. Ribs are done when about 3 / 8 inch of bones are exposed and the rib bones come loose from the meat when twisted 15. Remove from heat , re-season with rub mixture , and let sit for at least 30 min prior to cutting into 2-rib portions

1. Heat oil in a large pot 2. Add pork and brown well on all sides 3. Add onion and garlic and cook for 5 minutes to lightly brown 4. Stir in tomatillos , chiles , chipotle peppers , broth and seasonings 5. Bring to a boil 6. Reduce heat and simmer , covered , for 1 1 / 2 to 2 hours or until tender 7. Serve over cooked rice with guacamole and sour cream

1. Heat the vegetable oil in skillet over medium heat , and brown the ribs on all sides 2. Transfer to a slow cooker 3. Mix 6. Dip in more potato starch then bread crumbs 7. Deep fry in older oil 375 degrees fahrenheit until dark spots of blood seep out of bones or until golden 8. Dry on paper towels 9. Spritz with lemon juice 10. This was given to me by a cook who only makes 10 pounds at a time so adjust as needed

1. Saute shrimp and garlic in oil until mostly cooked , about 2 minutes 2. Stir in cornstarch and cook 1 minute , stirring frequently 3. Add broth , tomatoes , peas , pepperoni and tobasco 4. Stir together 5. Add minute rice , stir and cover 6. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes 7. Fluff with fork and serve

1. Wash the rice well 2. Drain 3. Melt butter / margarine / ghee in a saucepan over low to medium heat 4. Saute garlic paste / powder / minced garlic in butter for about 15 seconds , then add the chopped onions and saute until browned , about 5-10 minutes 5. Now add carrots , peas , salt , and water , stir , bring to a boil , cover , reduce heat to low , and cook , without stirring , until the rice is tender , about 15-20 minutes 7. Uncover and evaporate excess water if any , remove from flame , and fluff up with a fork 8. Season with extra salt and pepper , if necessary , and serve hot !

1. Remove 2. Saute mushrooms and onions in butter in a large skillet for 2-3 minutes or until onions soften 3. Add beef and cook until browned , then add beef stock and simmer for 5 minutes 4. Whisk together cornstarch with teriyaki sauce and set aside 5. Pour mixture into skillet and cook , stirring , until mixture thickens 6. Stir in the mango chunks , snow peas and green onions , and cook until heated through 7. Serve over steamed brown rice

1. Flatten the chicken to 1 / 4 inch thickness 2. Place flour in a large resealable plastic bag 3. Add chicken and shake to coat 4. In a skillet over medium heat , brown chicken in oil for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until juices run clear and chicken is cooked thoroughly 5. Remove and keep warm 6. Drain pineapple , reserving 1 / 4 cup juice 7. In a small bowl , combine juice and cornstarch until smooth 8. Add to skillet 9. Stir in honey , soy sauce , and pepper 10. Boil for 30 seconds or until thickened 11. Add pineapple and chicken 12. Heat through 13. Serve over rice

1. Preheat oven to 375f degrees 2. In a dutch oven , over medium-high heat , add sausage , onions , pepper and celery 3. When sausage is browned , stir in rice and almonds 4. In a separate bowl , combine dry soup mix with boiling water 5. Stir well 6. Stir soup mixture into dutch oven and combine 7. Cover casserole and bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes 8. Uncover and bake for an additional 50 minutes 9. Serves a lot !

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees 2. Butter one side of each slice of wonder bread and press each slice butter-side down into the cups of a muffin tin 3. In a medium bowl , mix together the ground beef , egg , onion , cream of mushroom soup , salt and pepper until well blended 4. Add this point add the tabasco sauce if using -- turning up the heat 5. Fill each bread cup with the mixture 6. Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the tops 7. Bake for 30 minutes or until meat is cooked through

1. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown ground beef with green pepper , onion and black pepper until beef is cooked through 2. Drain off excess fat and transfer beef to a 3 (1 / 2) to 5-quart crock pot 3. Add lettuce, tomatoes', velveeta cheese, milk, pickle relish, prepared mustard, ketchup 4. Cover and cook on low for 5 to 7 hours 5. Serve the beef on toasted sandwich buns.

1. In mixing bowl , combine cubed bread and milk 2. Mash together until milk is completely incorporated 3. Add fresh tarragon, dijon mustard, salt, black pepper and gently mix with spoon or handsand  be sure to completely mix in bread mixture 4. Form into four patties and grill , 5. Turning once , until turkey is cooked through.

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F 2. Toast the bread lightly, cut a hole in the center of each slice with a 1( 1 / 2) inch circular cutter 3. Butter an ovenproof dish 4. Put the toast in it and break open an egg over each one so that the yolk falls in the hole in the center   5. Add salt and pepper to taste and spoon the buttermilk evenly over the four parts 6. Bake for 15 minutes.

1. Remove the crusts from the bread 2. Spread each slice of bread evenly with vegemite 3. Push bread gently into 8 x 1 / 2 cup capacity muffin pan to form a pastry case 4. Cook the bacon in a frying pan over medium heat until crisp 5. Divide evenly into cases, and combine cheese spread and eggs until mixed and pour mixture into the bread cases 6. Bake at 180 degree C for 10-15 minutes or until bread is golden and filling has just set.

1. Combine milk and pudding mix and whisk until smooth and beginning to thicken 2. Fold in half of the whipped topping and set aside 3. Arranges six of the ice cream sandwiches side by side on a large platter 4. Spread the filling evenly over the sandwiches, then place remaining sandwiches on top - creating a rectangular "torte" shape 5. Smooth the sides and spread remaining whipped topping over the top and the sides of the torte 6. Grate the chocolate morsels over everything 7. Freeze until firm , but not hard. If freezing it over night , remove about 30-45 minutes before serving.

1. Arrange 14 sandwiches in the bottom of a 9x13 dish 2. Cut the remaining sandwiches in half and fill the spaces 3. Spread on the caramel and top with whipped topping 4. Drizzle on chocolate syrup and shave the chocolate bar with a vegetable peeler 5. Place shavings on the top and cover and freeze at least 45 minutes.

1. Pour the fudge topping into a medium bowl 2. Stir in 1 c of the whipped topping with a wire whisk until it's well blended 3. Add in the dry pudding mix and stir 2 minute or until well blended 4. Chop the oreo cookies roughly into chunks and stir into the pudding mixture 5. Arrange 4 of the ice cream sandwiches , side by side , on a 24x12-inch piece of foil' and top with half of the pudding mixture 6. Repeat layers and top the pudding mixture with the remaining 4 ice cream sandwiches 7. Frost the top and sides with the remaining whipped topping 8. Bring up the foil sides and double fold top and ends to loosely seal the packet 9. Freeze at least 4 hours before serving and store leftover dessert in the freezer.

1. Coarsely chop cookies and set aside 2.Combine milk and pudding mix and immediately stir in half of the cool whip and cookies and set filling aside 3. Arrange six ice cream sandwiches side by side in a 9x13 inch pan 4. Spread filling over sandwiches and top with remaining ice cream sandwiches 5. Spread cool whip on sides and top. 6. Top with sprinkles and freeze until ready to serve.

1. Pour syrup into a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 2 minutes 2. Stir peanut butter into syrup until smooth and allow to cool to room temperature 3. Line 9x13-inch dish with 9 (1 / 2) ice cream sandwiches 4. Spread half the whipped topping over the sandwiches 5. Spoon half the chocolate mixture over the whipped topping and top with half the peanuts 6. Repeat layers and freeze for one hour or until firm 7. Cut into squares to serve.

1. Set oven to 375 degrees, leaving the heads whole 2. Peel off as much of the papery skin as possible 3. Place the whole garlic heads in an oven-proof dish, large enough to hold them in a single layer 4. Pour the 1 / 2 cup water in the dish , sprinkle with salt , and drizzle with olive oil 5. Cover tightly with foil 6. Bake in in a preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until the garlic is easily pierced with a knife 7. Remove from the oven and let sit until cool enough to handle 8. Squeeze out the garlic cloves from there skin into a small bowl and mash into a paste 9. Raise the oven temperature to 400 degrees F 10. In a medium bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, egg , fontina , parmesan cheese and pesto until smooth 11. Place the boboli crusts on 2 large baking sheets and spread a thin layer of the garlic paste over the prepared crusts 12. Spread an even amount of the ricotta mixture over the garlic paste, sprinkle both pizzas evenly with the sun-dried tomatoes , canned diced tomatoes , zucchini , shrimp and mozza cheese 13. Bake for about 15 minutes , or until the cheese is melted and cut into wedges.

1. Coat chicken with 1 tbsp of the creole seasoning 2.Cook in 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet 3. Add celery , onion and green pepper and continue cooking until done 4. Stir in tomatoes , sauce , water , and shrimp 5. Add 1 tbsp of creole seasoning 6. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes 7. Add rice , cover and cook 5 minutes or until rice is done.

1. Saute onion and garlic in olive oil over medium heat until onion is almost tender 2. Sprinkle in 2 tablespoons old bay seasoning and stir constantly for about 30 seconds 3. Add in chicken stock , red wine vinegar , oregano , parsley , and tabasco 4. Bring to almost boiling over medium heat 5. While this is heating, lay out frozen seafood mix, shrimp, and catfish on a cutting board 6. Sprinkle with the juice from one lemon then sprinkle with remaining one tablespoon old bay seasoning and black pepper 7. Let this stand while mixture is heating 8. When liquid is almost boiling add in the seafood mix , rice , tomato soup , canned tomatoes and okra and be sure to add all liquid from both the tomatoes and okra. 9. Add in the gumbo fil and simmer for 30 minutes , stirring occasionally.

1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees, line your baking dish with foil, and butter or spray with non stick cooking spray 2. Place the crabmeat in a large bowl and season with the cajun seasoning, old bay or salt and pepper 3. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use 4. In your fry pan, melt 4 tablespoons butter over medium-high heat 5. Add the onions , celery , and bell peppers and cook, stirring until softened for about 4 minutes 6. Add the parsley and the garlic, and cook, stirring for 1 minute 7. Remove from heat and let cool 8. Add the cooled vegetables to the crabmeat and toss to combine 9. Add the mayonnaise , egg , lemon juice , worcestershire and hot sauce and stir gently and add 1 cup of cracker crumbs , salt and pepper to taste , and stir gently , being careful not to break up the crabmeat 10. Spoon the crabmeat stuffing evenly into each shrimp , and place , stuffed sides up in your baking dish and drizzle with the remaining melted butter, bake until golden for about 20 minutes.

1. Heat oil in a large dutch oven over medium-high heat 2. Gradually whisk in flour and cook and whisking constantly for 5 to 7 minutes or until flour is chocolate colored and do not burn mixture 3. Reduce heat to medium, stir in onion and green bell peppe, celery, creole seasoning, garlic cloves and cook , stirring constantly for 3 minutes 4. Gradually stir in chicken broth, add chicken and andouille sausage, frozen black-eyed pea 5. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil 6. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally for 20 minutes 7. Add shrimp and cook 5 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink, serve over hot rice.

1. Cook onion and garlic in olive oil over medium heat until softened 2. Add flour and cook for about three minutes , stirring constantly 3. Add milk , chicken broth , sausage , grape tomatoes , balsamic vinegar , pesto and salt and pepper and stir constantly until sauce thickens 4. Once sauce thickens , add cheese and stir until melted and heated through 5. Toss with spaghetti and serve with parmesan cheese.

1. Combine evaporated milk , parmesan cheese , parsley , basil , 1 tsp salt , 1 / 4 tsp pepper in bowl , set aside. 2. Cook spaghetti in boiling water and oil and 2 tsp salt in a large uncovered pot for 11-13 minutes , or until tender 3. Drain and transfer to big bowl, cover with foil to keep warm 4. Heat wok or frying pan on medium-high heat, add 1 tbsp oil , add carrots , onion , celery and garlic , stir fry until soft 5. Transfer to big bowl, add 1 tbsp oil to hot wok , add cauliflower and broccoli 6. Stir fry 4 minutes , add pea pods and zucchini and stir fry 2 minutes 7. Add tomatoes and evaporated milk mixture , stir until heated through 8. Transfer to big bowl toss to mix every thing and par boil them for 5 minutes.

1. Cook the spaghetti in boiling , salted water until chewy 2. Save about a quarter cup of the water when you drain the pasta 3. Saut the garlic in the oil and butter until the garlic is soft 4. Add salt and pepper and add the cooked pasta and the reserved cooking water to the pan and cook for 1 or 2 minutes 5. Add the cheese, scramble the eggs lightly in a separate pan and add them to the pasta and cook for another minute or so until the eggs are set to your comfort level amd sprinkle with parsley.

1. Fry the chopped onion in one stick of butter until golden 2. Add the ground beef, the chopped garlic salt and pepper 3. Brown sufficiently and then add the tomato paste and the water and cook for 20 minutes 4. Make a white sauce and melt the stick of butter and add the flour when it has cooked add milk to make a medium sauce 5. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions 6. In a buttered casserole put 1 / 2 of the pasta, top with a layer of meat sauce and add the other part of the pasta and top with the balance of the meat sauce 7. Top with the white sauce and bake at 350degree F for about 20 minutes or until bubbly.

1. Cook spaghetti in a 5-6-quart nonstick pot or pan in boiling water until barely tender drain and set aside 2. In a bowl mix the beef broth with black bean sauce and cornstarch and set aside 3. Heat oil in the same pot that was used to boil the spaghetti 4. Add in ground beef with minced garlic, dried chili flakes and onion slices 5. Cook until beef is browned , season with black pepper to taste 6. Add in the uncooked broccoli florets with drained mushrooms and 1 / 2 cup water to the beef mixture 7. Cover and cook stirring occasionally until the broccoli is a bright green colour 8. Add in beef broth mixture and bring to a boil 8. Cook for 2-4 minutes and add in the cooked spaghetti , stir over medium heat until heated through and well coated with the sauce 9. Add in soy sauce to taste if desired.

1. Brown the meat and sausage in a large frying pan 2. When meat is about half done , add the onion , bell pepper , and garlic and continue cooking until the onion is transparent 3. Add the tomato sauce , paste , water and seasonings, mix well and cover and simmer for 20 minutes 4.  Stirring occasionally,  beat the eggs and ricotta together 5. Season to taste with salt and pepper 6. Preheat oven to 325 and spray a 9x13-inch pan with olive oil cooking spray 7. Spread 1 / 2 of the meat mixture in the bottom of the pan 8. Top with sliced zucchini, spread the zucchini with the ricotta mixture and top with the spinach and mushroom slices 9. Top that layer with with half of the mozzarella and parmesan cheeses and cover with the remaining meat mixture and top with the remaining cheeses 10. Bake at 325 degree F until the cheese is bubbly and beginning to get golden , about 35 to 45 minutes.

1. Heat oven to 400 degrees 2. Heat the oil in medium skillet over medium-high heat 3. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute 4. Add the tomatoes , 1 / 2 teaspoon salt , and 1 / 4 teaspoon pepper and simmer for 3 minutes 5. Add the spinach and cook until it begins to wilt  6. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish and beat the egg whites until foamy about 30 seconds ,then pour them over the spinach mixture 7. Carefully place the whole yolks over the top 8. Bake until the whites are set for around 20-22 minutes 9. Divide among individual plates and add dollops of the cream cheese , if desired.

1. Preheat oven to 375f degrees and prepare a cookie sheet covered with tinfoil for easy cleanup 2. Place two tortilla on cookie sheet , split 1 / 4 cup mozzarella cheese in half and sprinkle on each tortilla 3.  Place a second tortilla on top of the cheese sprinkled ones and spread half of the pizza sauce on each tortilla crust 4. Sprinkle half of the cut spinach over the sauce , then half of the pepper , diced tomato and grated carrot over each 5. Combine the remaining mozzarella and cheddar and sprinkle half on each tortilla 6. Place cookie sheet on the middle rack of preheated oven and bake for approximately 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbling and crust edges are brown.

1. In mixing bowl,  add spinach dip and sour cream 2. Mix and add corn and mix again 3. Melt margarine in microwave 4. Add stovetop dressing or dressing cubes and pour over the melted margarine and mix well 5. Add 1 / 4 tsp salt or salt substitute and add pepper to taste and mix 6. Preheat oven 375f and spray pam in a round deep 1 (1 / 2) quart casserole dish 7. Pile into casserole dish and place foil on top and cook 25 minutes.

1. Pan fry bacon , and set aside on a paper towel to absorb excess grease 2. Mince yellow onion , red bell pepper , and add to your mixing bowl 3. Chop garlic and set aside and put 1tbsp olive oil into a saut pan 4.  Along with chopped garlic , teaspoons white pepper and a pinch of kosher salt and bring to a medium heat to sweat your garlic 5. Preheat oven to 350f and coarsely chop your baby spinach add to your heated pan and stir frequently for approximately 5 min to wilt 6. Add your spinach to the mixing bowl 7. Chop your now cooled bacon and add it to the mixing bowl 8. Add your meatloaf mix to the bowl , with one egg and mix till thoroughly combined and add your goat cheese , one egg , 1 / 8 tsp white pepper and 1 / 8 tsp of kosher salt and mix till thoroughly combined 9. Transfer to a 9x5 meatloaf pan , and cook for 60 min or until the internal temperature is at least 160f 10. Let stand for 5min and melt 1tbsp unsalted butter into a frying pan , and cook up to three eggs at a time and crack each egg into a separate dish , in order to prevent egg shells from reaching the pan , then add salt and pepper to taste 10. Wait until the egg whites are firm looking , but slightly runny on top before flipping your eggs. 11. After flipping , wait 10 to 20 seconds before removing each egg and placing it over your slices of meatloaf.

1. Rub the steaks with garlic and season well with salt and pepper 2. Heat butter in a large skillet and fry steaks over high heat for about 2 minutes on each side 3. Remove steaks to a warm serving dish and keep hot 4. HGeat the remaining butter and quickly saute the sliced mushrooms and chopped onions in skillet on med-high heat until tender 5. Add the lemon juice , worcestershire sauce and brandy to pan , bring to a boil 6. Stir in the cream and parsley and bring almost to a boil 7. Pour this sauce quickly over steaks and serve garnish with parsley.

1. Heat olive oil in large skillet 2. Flour pork steaks and brown in hot oil 3. Reduce burner to medium 4. Add potatoes , carrots , and onions 5. Put into a small bowl , parmesan , soup , mushrooms , lemon juice , garlic , garlic salt , worcestershire , thyme , pepper , water , and chicken bouillon cube 6. Mix together and add to skillet 7. Heat to boiling , reduce heat to low , cover , and simmer until potatoes are tender around 50 to 60 minutes 8. check on about halfway through-stir , flip meat over.

1. Trim fat from beef 2. Cut beef into 1 / 2 inch cubes 3. Mix egg white , cornstarch , sesame oil and white pepper in medium glass or plastic bowl 4. Stir in beef and let stand 10 minutes 5. Cook and drain noodles as directed on package and while noodles are cooking , spray 12-inch nonstick skillet or wok with nonstick cooking spray 6. Heat over medium to high heat 7. Add beef and stir-fry about 3 minutes or until brown 8. Add asparagus and bell pepper and stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender and add stir-fry sauce 9. Stir fry about 1 minute or until heated through serve over noodles.

1. Cut steak into serving sizes and dredge with your favorite seasoned flour 2. Melt 1 / 4 cup butter in large frying pan and add mushrooms and onions 3. Cook until onions are tender and the mushrooms are just lightly browned 4. Remove from pan and set aside 5. Add remaining butter and when melted add the steak and brown on each side 6. Stir in rest of ingredients and the mushroom mix 7. Cover and cook until meat is tender enough to cut with a fork.

1. Cut round steak into 6 serving size pieces 2. On a cutting board , dredge pieces with flour , salt and pepper 3. Pound flour into the meat with a meat mallet 4. Turn pieces , dredge , and pound until they can't hold any more flour 5. In a large non-stick skillet , heat oil and brown steak pieces on both sides 6. Place in a covered casserole and add onions and garlic to the skillet 7. Saute until onions are limp 8. Place onions and garlic over steak pieces in casserole dish 9. Add enough beef broth to barely cover meat 10. Bake at 300 degree f for 2 hours or until fork-tender', 'serve over noodles or mashed potatoes.

1. Set oven to 350 degree 2. Butter a 13 x 9-inch baking dish 3. Place potatoes in prepared dish , and set aside 4. In a saucepan , combine brown sugar , cornstarch , salt and cinnamon 5. Stir in apricot nectar water and orange peel 6. Bring to a boil , stirring constantly , cook , and stir for 2 minutes more 7. Remove from heat and stir in butter and pecans 8. Pour over sweet potatoes and season with black pepper 9. Bake while uncovered for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.

1. Preheat oven to 350f 2. Place chicken , vegetables , and parsley in a 2 (1 / 2) qt baking dish 3. In a saucepan , melt butter over medium heat and saute garlic for 2 minutes 4. Stir in the 6 tablespoons of flour and cook with stirring constantly for 1 minute to make roux 5. Add half-and-half and chicken broth slowly , still stirring constantly 6. Season with salt , pepper , and thyme, continue cooking and stirring until sauce boils and thickens 7. Pour sauce over chicken and vegetble mixture and sift remaining cup of flour together with baking powder and salt into a bowl 8. With a fork , work in mashed sweet potatoes with vegetable oil and egg and lightly flour a board and roll out dough with a rolling pin to about 1 / 4 thick 9. Cover casserole dish with dough and pinch edges all the way around 10 . Make several small slits in the dough and bake until crust is golden-brown.

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees 2. Mash the sweet potatoes, mix the sugar , melted butter , eggs , milk , vanilla and cinnamon into the sweet potatoes 3. Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray and pour potato mixture into it 4. Mix the topping ingredients together in a small bowl 5. Sprinkle topping over the sweet potato mixture 6. Bake for approximately 35 minutes , or until the casserole gets brown and bubbly.

1. Melt butter in a dutch oven or large saucepan over medium-high heat 2. Saut onion for 3-4 minutes then add flour , curry , garlic , cumin and nutmeg and saut for 1 minute 3. Add sweet potato , salt , chicken broth and pumpkin and bring to a boil 4. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer , partially covered for about 20-25 minutes or until sweet potatoes are cooked through and softened 5. Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes to cool 6. Place half of the pumpkin mixture in a blender and process until smooth 7. Using a strainer , pour soup back into pan and repeat with rest of soup 8. Raise heat to medium then stir in milk and cook for 5 minutes or until soup is heated through 9. Remove from heat and add lime juice.

1. Peel and cube the squash and sweet potato 2. Chop the carrots and put in a pot and add water to just cover the vegetables 3. Boil until vegetables are soft , then mash with a fork 4. Add the yogurt and the broth 5. Squeeze the juice out of the mandarin and stir well so that the solids mix with the liquids 6. Add spices , honey , salt and pepper.

1. Slice pork into thin strips 2. Heat oil in a heavy frying pan and brown pork well 3. Add onion , garlic and ginger and cook until the onion has softened 4. Add cubed tofu and broth and cook 10 minutes 5. Season with sugar and soy sauce, cook covered for 5 minutes 6. Add cornstarch which has been mixed with a little water and stir gently until thickened 7. Let steam for a minute 8. Add sliced green onion and steam for a minute.

1. Bake squash cut side down , 400f degrees oven for 45 minutes and while squash is baking,  in a skillet heat oil , saute onions , ginger , garlic , dill weed and basil 2. Cook over medium heat until they begin to brown 3. Add chopped pepper , continue to cook for approximately 2 minutes 4. Put the tofu in a saucepan , add tahini and mix well 5. Slowly add the water and cook over low heat , stirring with a whisk until sauce is thoroughly combined 6. Add flour to the sauted veggies and combine veggies and the tahini-tofu sauce 7. Continue to simmer on very low heat add tamari and pepper, mix in parsley and serve over squash

1. Slice carrots and steam , set aside. 2. Saute parsley and garlic for 1 minute in an oiled pan 3. Add carrots and veggie broth and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes 4. Add tofu , vegan cream cheese , and lemon juice and stir well 5. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until "cheese" starts to melt 6. Stir in nutmeg and nutritional yeast, remove from heat 7. Place 3 lasagna noodles in bottom of 11x7 baking dish 8. Layer carrot mixture , noodles , tomato sauce and spinach until done 8. Top with spaghetti sauce, cover and bake 15 minutes at 375 degrees F 9.uncover and bake an additional 30 minutes until thoroughly heated.

1. Cut the tofu across the width into 6 slabs 2. Cut each slab in half to make 12 squares 3. Blot the tofu to remove some of the moisture and set aside 4. Whisk together the balsamic vinegar , soy sauce , honey , garlic , and ginger in a small bowl and set aside 5. Saute the broccoli in 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat until bright green and starting to brown in places for about 5 minutes 6. Remove broccoli from the pan, saute the red pepper in 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat until it starts to brown for about 3 minutes 7. Remove the red pepper from the pan, saute the tofu in the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium-high heat until browned , 2 minutes per side 8. Add the vinegar mixture to the tofu and simmer until slightly thickened for about 1 minute 9. Return the broccoli and peppers to the pan and gently toss to coat with the sauce 10. Garnish with the scallions and serve with brown rice or another grains.

1. Steam the bok choy until wilted 2. After it cools , drain it and finely chop it, make sure there is no excess liquid 3. Place bok choy in a medium sized bowl, puree tofu and egg whites in a food processor 4. Add this mixture to the bok choy, add scallions to bok choy mixture 5. Combine the remaining ingredients , except for the wonton wrappers , in a small bowl 6. Add this to the bok choy mixture and mix well. 7. To form the dumplings: put about 2 teaspoons of the bok choy mixture into the center of a wonton wrapper 8. Pull sides of dough up and pinch them together at three or four points, leaving the middle of the filling exposed at the top 9. Steam the dumpling over boiling water for about 4 minutes or until they look cooked through 10. When eating , you can dip these in a little soy sauce or other asian sauces.

1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F 2. Cut potato in half lengthwise 3. Scoop out pulp from potato halves into a bowl , leaving 1 / 4-inch-thick shells, mash pulp and reserve shells 4. Add 1 ounce mozzarella cheese , the tomato sauce , ricotta cheese , oregano and garlic powder to potato pulp and stir to combine 5. Spoon half of potato mixture into each reserved shell 6. Top each with half of the remaining mozzarella cheese and half of the parmesan cheese 7. Set potato shells in 1-quart casserole and bake until thoroughly heated , about 10 minutes.

1. Cook onions , carrots and garlic in cooking oil until tender-crisp 2. In a large deep skillet , brown meat and drain fat 3. Add cooked vegetable mixture and seasonings to cooked meat, cook and stir 1 minute 4. Add remaining ingredients except for cheese, bring to a boil , reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes , stirring occasionally 5.serve topped with cheese.

1. Heat oven to 375 degrees f 2.Brown ground beef and onion over medium heat 3. Drain and stir in tomato sauce , taco or other sauce , salt , pepper , tabasco , chiles , and cornmeal 4. Adjusting for "hot" taste preference and desired thickness, stir in more cornmeal , if desired, stir in corn and olives 5. Transfer mixture to casserole dish, cover and bake for 30 to 40 minutes 6. Top with cheese immediately on removing from oven so cheese melts 7. Garnish with corn chips just before serving to keep them crisp 8.serve with a cool fresh vegetable such as cucumber slices , avocado , or lettuce leaves.

1. Heat bacon grease, add onion and fry until golden 2. Add flour, salt, and pepper and cook until light brown, stirring constantly 3. Add canned tomatoes, sugar, bay leaf, and celery leaves or celery salt and cook for another five minutes  4. Remove bay leaf, rub through a strainer or serve without straining for chunkier sauce and adjust seasonings to taste.

1. Heat olive oil in a dutch oven over medium heat 2. Add onion , carrots and garlic and cook until onion is tender for about 6 minutes 3. Increase heat to high and add broth, tomatoes , picante sauce , beans , corn and spices 4. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and cover and finally simmer for 30 minutes 5. Add chicken and cilantro, cook until thoroughly heated 6. Ladle into soup bowls and top with tortilla chips , cubed avocados , and cheese.

1. Preheat oven to 350f 2. Have ready an ungreased baking sheet 3. In a mixing bowl , combine tuna , onion , pepper , mayo and worcestershire 4. Taste and add salt and / or pepper if you wish. 5. In the toaster , toast bagel halves and place all 4 on baking sheet  6. On a bagel half , place one slice tomato  and then one-quarter of tuna mixture , then 1 slice cheese and repeat with other bagel halves 7. Bake for 5 minutes , or until cheese melts.

1. Mix the cream of chicken , mayonnaise and milk together in a large bowl 2. Add the diced celery and onion 3. Fold in the tuna , followed by the cooked egg noodles and shredded cheddar cheese 4. Add salt and pepper to your taste 5. Place in a casserole dish, cook at 375 degrees for about 40-45 minutes , just until the top starts to brown.

1. In a 5-quart stove-top pot , bring water to a boil 2. Add pasta and hold at a boil until tender, then turn off the heat and drain pasta in the 5-quart pot  3. Add tuna , peas , and can of soup, stir gently to not break the pasta 4. Pour mixture into a 9x12-inch baking dish or an 8x8 baking dish 5. distribute cheese evenly over the pasta mix 6. Let it cool and cover it after 20 minutes  7.  Put it directly into a 350f oven and bake uncovered for 30 minutes

1. Toast the bread and cut into 1 / 2-inch cubes 2. Set aside and reserve 2 tablespoons of the dark green scallion stems 3. In a large bowl, whisk the vinegar and salt, add 1 / 2 cup oil and whisk to combine 4. Add the tuna , tomato , all the chopped scallions except reserved stems , celery , 4 tablespoons capers , and bread 5. Toss and set aside for 15 to 30 minutes at room temperature 6. toss occasionally, taste a bread cube, if it seems too dry , drizzle with a bit more oil or a few tablespoons of cold water. If too bland , add up to 1 tablespoon more vinegar and 1 tablespoon more capers, sprinkle each serving with scallion stems']

1. Boil potatoes in salted water to cover until tender for about 20 minutes 2. Remove with slotted spoon and let cool 3. Add beans to same water and boil until crisp-tender for about 7 minutes 4. Drain and cool under cold running water 5. Arrange potatoes , beans , olives , eggs , and tomato on large platter and spoon tuna into center 6. Whisk vinegar , mustard , 1 / 8 t salt , and pepper to taste in small bowl until blended 7. Gradually pour in oil , whisking until emulsified, whisk in parsley , then drizzle vinaigrette over salad.

1. For the cheese filling preparation. First, beat the eggs and the pinch of baking soda , than add crumbed white cheese and then the yoghurt. For spiral banitsa / traditional preparation, use a round pan +-40cm diameter. 2. Take 12 pastry sheets, grease bottom of a pan with butter 3. Spread a sheet , put a 2-3 small cubes of butter , and spread the filling, roll the sheet and place it in the middle of the pan. 4. Do all the sheets the same way and join it with the end of the first sheet , making your spiral bigger and bigger. 5. When you out the last sheet and finish the spiral and fill the pan pore a tea cup of milk over the spiral, bake in moderate oven for 45-50 minute. 6. When it is ready take it out of the oven and brush with water the surface and cover with a cloth until it cools down.  7. Serve with an extra small bowl of plain yoghurt.

1. Drain beans and bring to boil in plenty of fresh water 2.cook until tender, heat the oil and add cumin and sizzle approx 30 second. 3. Add broccoli and tomatoes , stirring constantly. 4. Add paprika , yoghurt and garlic, mix and cook 7-8 minutes over a low heat. 5. Add drained black eyed beans , turmeric , garam masala , and salt. 6. Mix , and cook 2-3 minutes. 7. Add 3 / 4 cup water and bring to the boil, reduce heat , and simmer 10-15 miutes.

1. Put the drained chickpeas in a saucepan and enough water to cover them and bring to boil . 2. Cover and simmer for about an hour till they are absolutely tender. 3. Drain them thoroughly and in a large bowl mash the chickpeas to a pulp. 4. Add the oil in a saucepan and gently fry the onion , green chillies , garlic and ginger until softened but not browned for about 5-6 minutes. 5.Then add in the ground spices and fry for another 5 minutes. 6. Remove from heat and add them to the mashed chickpeas and also add in the lemon juice , yoghurt and chopped coriander , season well and give it all a good mix 7. When the mixture is cool enough to handle , form into 12 patties , they should be about inch thick. 8.
